If you've been reading this blog for awhile now, you'd know that my favorite holiday is the Super Bowl weekend. I enjoy watching and attending football games at a sports bar. However this year, my love for football has faded since the Cowboys haven't been able to win. Last year they made the playoffs, this is the first year I've been truly disappointed. Plus, I just don't get too excited about regular season. It just doesn't matter, except to football junkies like me. That and I like to think the Patriots will get the big prize for winning the past 16 years.

As the Dallas Cowboy's were losing, I was watching the rest of the Super Bowl festivities. One of the best things about Super Bowl Sunday is the food and entertainment that happens outside. If you're on a budget, you can even make a lot of the food yourself. I'm taking over the stove and you only need a recipe to have a healthy, cheap supper that will warm you through and through. I'm talking about the best Super Bowl party food ever!

You're probably thinking "but Mina, that's not supper, that's a dessert". Believe me, I am fully aware of the difference, so I'm going to make a point. This is supper. I have yet to cook chicken enchiladas for a party. I had chicken wraps made a few years ago using chicken breast. I have yet to make wings. I'm not saying it wouldn't be delicious, because I am sure it would be. But the point is, I don't like to spend a lot of money when it comes to Super Bowl day. I'd like to save that money for other things like tickets and other fun food and festivities.

There is no chicken enchilada in sight, no wings being cooked right now and there will be no chicken wraps for me to make this year. Instead of spending money on other Super Bowl weekend food, I have made chicken fajitas with corn chips. You may think that's not worth mentioning. But I want to make a point that food isn't a big deal. You don't have to spend a lot of money (or even that much money) so stop thinking it is. It isn't.

So the real question is do you care to be one of the three people who know about these amazing chicken fajitas? Because they're not good for just one. Share them or keep the recipe for yourself and your party guests. So

A new approach to estimate the number of genes encoded per chromosome.
The present paper describes a new technique of studying the proportion of the genes located at the centromeric region in the chromosomes of microorganisms. It is based upon the method developed by Smit, J., et al., 1984, for the estimation of the gene content of eukaryotic chromosome. The distribution of genes over short chromosome segments was determined in the chromosomes of Escherichia coli, Streptomyces griseus and Saccharomyces cerevisiae using the method of differential staining of the nucleotides (Southern, 1979. J. Mol. Biol. 95: 503-527). The results indicate a considerable decrease in the level of the centromeric genes in comparison with those obtained directly by the method of differential staining of the nucleotides. A new criterion was used, which indicates that the decrease in gene content is more clearly visible. The correlation between the new and the traditional estimates of gene content is good; a coefficient of correlation of 0.94 is obtained. The distribution of genes over the segments of chromosomes was calculated using the new method and a new function describing the relationship between gene content and gene number in one chromosome (J. Theor. Biol. 129(1), 53-79, 1988).

Alex Castellanos, a former Arizona Republican Party treasurer and chief of staff for former Sen. Jeff Flake, testified at the criminal trial of accused Arizona immigrant-smuggling Paul Horner that he worked with a man named Gustavo to use fake names on illegal immigrants' registration forms for Arizona's March primary.

Advertisement:

Castellanos was asked by Horner's prosecutor if there was an effort to get people "who would not vote for you" to vote for Flake, according to CNN. In response, Castellanos replied that there was a "tactical discussion on the direction we needed to take to try and get as many people registered and as many people voting in the primary."

Castellanos admitted that several of the names he registered showed up on the Democratic registration rolls, but did not know if all of the individuals in Horner's group were immigrants.

"We thought those names would be helpful in getting people activated or registered. But we didn't count on just how effective they were," he said. "It's a complicated process that we weren't really ready for or prepared for."

Advertisement:

Q:

How many different ways there can be a total of $n$ objects drawn from a bag of $m$ distinct objects.

A bag has $m$ objects. Of these objects, a random number of $k$ objects are removed from the bag, the objects that are removed being drawn at random. What is the mean number of distinct objects in the remaining bag?

To be clear: given 
$m = a_1 < a_2 \cdots < a_m$, $ n = a_1+a_2+ \cdots + a_{r-1}+r$, $ k = a_r+ \cdots + a_{r+s-1}$, $ r = k-s+1$, and $s = \min \{ m, r \}$, then the answer to the question above is $(a_1+a_2+ \cdots + a_{k-1})/(a_1+a_2+ \cdots + a_k)$
For example, take $m=6, k=4, n=21$, so $r=4, s=3$, and the mean number of different objects is $(5+3+1)/(5+4) = 5/3$
This is my understanding of the problem, I am unsure if my answer is correct and I am also not sure how to go about deriving the mean number. I would appreciate if someone could point out a flaw in my reasoning, my thinking, or my solution above. Thanks!

A:

There are $k$ objects to choose from and $n-k$ that you want (which can be chosen multiple times).  If you choose the first $a_1$ objects, then that does not limit the choices of the second set of $a_2$ objects, and so on until all $a_k$ objects are chosen.  
This results in a sum of $\displaystyle\sum_{k=1}^{n-1}\binom{n-1}{k}$ such choices of objects.  In your example this sums to $1\cdot 9 + 2\cdot 1 + 2\cdot 2 + 1\cdot 4 + 1\cdot 2 + 1\cdot 2$ = $14$.

This is a very interesting look by Professor John Gertner at the Center on Budget and and Policy Priorities that suggests the “war on poverty” is over.

The real war against poverty, though, continues.

As long as government safety nets and the poverty rate are measured using the definitions and methodologies that John Gertner and others have established, the war on poverty is over. If the goal is to cut poverty and inequality rather than simply to reduce poverty, it is clear that the most important policy change would be to eliminate safety-net programs. To the extent these programs help the working poor, the wealthy must subsidize them by reducing their taxes or else they would have to raise the taxes or the prices of goods that they produce, thereby increasing inequality. The same is true for the non-working poor. Thus both groups of poor would experience rising inequality and falling wages and incomes as a result of changes in the programs that pay for the poor.

Gertner concludes:

…the real, long term struggle against poverty is to reform the safety net. But because safety net benefits have been such a useful measure as to whether the “war” is “over,” and because no politician likes to be called a “war” president, it will be very, very hard to do.

A new report on poverty from the Center on Budget and and Policy Priorities found that poverty is back — and increasing in many states. And when we’re talking about this year’s poverty rate, it’s a problem with both adults and children.

But it’s not the same old story. The new report confirms another trend we’ve seen in the past few years: More and more children are living in poverty.

We propose to investigate the mechanism of action of a natural protein fragment containing a single immunomodulatory amino acid sequence that we found in human myelin protein, MBP 84-99 (YKLPTPRT). This peptide has been used in several animal models of autoimmunity with evidence that it suppresses T cell mediated autoimmunity without affecting the efficacy of vaccinations against other antigens and can be used for the therapy of T cell dependent inflammatory diseases. We propose investigating whether the mechanism of suppression of T cell mediated inflammation due to the MBP-YKLPTPRT includes modulation of regulatory T cells. The studies proposed herein provide a unique opportunity to investigate a new mechanism of therapeutic action through the manipulation of a natural, immune-derived regulatory product from the brain.

In recent years computer systems employing the internet Protocol (IP) as their network layer have become increasingly prevalent. As a consequence, it has become critically important to develop more efficient network protocols to support such systems and to facilitate communications utilizing the internet protocol.
The internet protocol is a connectionless protocol that enables the transmission of data from a sender to a receiver in the form of data frames. Each data frame has destination and source addresses to enable the receiver to route the data frame to its intended destination. Other data frames may be transmitted between the sender and a router that services the destination network address. Each router and every node on the internet or private network is capable of acting as both a sender, router, and destination network. A router or network device may process IP data frames in various ways before transmitting or sending the data frames to their final destination. For example, a router or network device may perform a checksum of the IP packet on the network to detect transmission errors. When such an error is detected, the router may transmit a message packet back to the source of the data frame. Packet traffic transmitted between network devices on the internet or private network can traverse many different paths between the source and the destination. To handle this situation, routers or similar network devices implement one of various routing algorithms to determine the best or least expensive way to route the data frame between given source and destination addresses. It is well known in the art to utilize either the distance vector algorithm, such as the Routing Information Protocol (RIP), or the link-state algorithm, such as the Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) algorithm to determine the path between an internet source and destination. It is also well known in the art to utilize the “next hop” of a network packet to determine the optimal path through a router, etc.
In a network utilizing the IP protocol, when a data frame is sent from a sender to a destination, there is no guarantee that the information in the data frame will reach its destination. Consequently, IP is not a reliable communication protocol. The concept of a quality of service (QOS) has been implemented in computer systems that use the IP protocol in order to provide some degree of predictability of the delivery of data from one network address to another. In order for the QOS scheme to be effective, the packets are marked with quality level values in order to help the receiver of the packets determine their delivery quality. It is known in the art to utilize one of several different techniques to mark the packets with the QOS parameters

Java's Thread.sleep() with "no-argument constructor"

I have used Thread.sleep(). Java gives the error such as 

thread must initialize non-repeating or non-reentrant or
  synchronized or breakpoint/debug-continue or debug-step-into or
  debug-into method

when I use "no-argument constructor". What does that mean and how should I handle this error?

A:

What does that mean?

It means the object on which sleep() is invoked hasn't been constructed yet and the method is waiting for the constructor to finish.

How should I handle this error?

You handle by either throwing an exception at the appropriate place in the program, or by using a method that won't fail.

Craniopharyngioma in a child: successful surgical resection without intra-operative angiography.
Craniopharyngiomas are rare tumours of the central nervous system, characterised by the common occurrence of hyperprolactinaemia and suprasellar expansion. In children, they may present with unusual neurological symptoms, such as seizures, vomiting, and hypothalamic disturbances. The standard treatment is surgery in order to relieve symptoms and reduce hormone secretion. However, tumour control is difficult, and recurrences are common, even after the complete surgical removal of gross tumour. There are a number of factors that may be considered to be predictors of recurrence, including size, degree of calcification and histological features. In children, a delay of surgery may be the better option before tumour maturation. Recent reports suggest that intra-operative angiography (IA) to identify vascular invasion by these tumours may help to avoid excessive tissue removal in these cases. In the current study, a 13-year-old girl who was diagnosed with a craniopharyngioma was treated with craniotomy and total removal of tumour without IA. After surgery, the patient had a good recovery from neurological symptoms and no further neurological deterioration was observed in the subsequent 6-month follow-up. The findings suggest that, in children, craniotomy without IA is an alternative treatment for craniopharyngiomas when IA is thought to be harmful.

Oral cancer in an Indian city: a survey of oral lesions and risk factors in an unselected population.
This is a survey of a series of consecutive, unselected cancer patients attending a major, tertiary-care centre in India. Patients were recruited from the Otorhinolaryngology outpatient clinic in a 1-year period. One hundred and sixteen new cases of malignant disease of the oral cavity were analyzed by an established clinical protocol. Risk factors were recorded by a standardized questionnaire. The age-standardized annual incidence of new cases was about 50-60 per 100.000 per year, depending on whether new cases were included or the cohort was restricted to only those above the age of 45 years at interview. A total of 40.9% of the cases had squamous cell carcinoma. Of those with cancers of the oral cavity, 50% had an adequate history of tobacco chewing; in some cases the duration of habits was more than 20 years. Forty percent of the patients with cancers of the tongue, floor of the mouth and gums were smokers.

(CNN) -- After a series of violent encounters with protesters in New York during the Republican National Convention last week, Philadelphia Police said Thursday they had arrested more than a dozen demonstrators involved in a variety of crimes.

"Of course there is anger," said Chief Inspector Scott Small, of the Philadelphia Police. "We arrested about a half dozen people, and that's a start. One of the things we will be looking at is these people before the convention starts, and if they're not going to be peaceful -- if they're going to cause any trouble, we're going to arrest people before the convention starts.

"It's time for the world to know about our city. One of the things we want to get across to the world is that we're not that violent. This is a family-friendly city, not a city where people can come in and cause trouble."

CNN's Michael Holmes visited several protesters Thursday morning who said they were not planning any protests to begin with, and that they did not believe they needed to be arrested by the police.

But many were upset about what they had seen of the demonstrations over the past few days.

One woman showed Holmes a picture she took Monday evening at a demonstration of 50 or so supporters of Republican presidential candidate John McCain, marching down the street chanting, "McCain is my president."

Two men standing behind her snapped a photo to mark their own time standing in protest. A young man with them shouted that the McCain supporters should have known they were not allowed on the park land where they were gathering last Tuesday.

"You said no!" the man yelled over his shoulder to the marchers. "Why do you let them come on our property?"

Asked why she had thought to take that picture, the woman said she wanted to "document my time. They started coming. When I saw it said you shouldn't be on the grass, I said, 'You all need to be arrested.' That's the only reason I took the picture."

The woman then turned her attention to the young man in front of her -- the guy with the camera.

"I don't think they should be on our property, and I think the way they're demonstrating, they're going after protesters," she said.

Asked to elaborate further, she said, "You don't have to take something away from my personal space. That's how I feel. They don't have the right, I don't think. Why

Q:

How to convert text/plain to text/html

A very simple html form (from the browser's source) uses text/plain as the submit type in its action element and text/html for the type attribute of the form. Now the browser displays the field's contents as "Text". How can I make it display html tags and not just the text?
I think I have to change its MIME type in the form's action.

A:

You can specify the type as MIME Media Type which is generally more powerful than the older MIME media types.
The first set of values specifies the type, the second set specify the subtype. The final value (ie. the value between ';' in PHP, ';' and '"') is optional. It simply can identify what this media type is:
HTTP/1.1
200 OK
Content-type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-length: 7

I can't test it for you, but i guess that should do the trick.

In this report, we review the latest news about the global Carbonation System market and provide key statistics about the market on the basis of type and end-use industry. This data includes values and volume in USD, as well as the cost and revenue break-down by region. The study provides historic and forecast market data from 2013 to 2019 on volume units, and value units that covers the entire Carbonation System value chain.

The report includes detailed data about the market value, volume, production, employment and value added of the Carbonation System market. In terms of the end-use industries and types, the market has been analyzed across the food & beverages; pharmaceuticals; industrial and household products; and personal care end-consumer industries. The study includes the consumption of raw materials, intermediates and final products. Market data is provided in terms of average price and value.

The report provides a detailed qualitative analysis of the parent market. It does this by providing a framework of the parent market with respect to growth rate, shared dynamics, and the major factors influencing the market growth. It discusses the key vendors and their product portfolios, regional distribution channels, and the market development trends.

Geographically, the study focuses on the growth markets. The report provides a clear picture of the market and provides more than 70 market data tables split by product, application, and regional segment.

A randomized, double-blinded study on the efficacy and safety of topical dapsone 0.1% gel over 2 months in pediatric patients with rosacea.
Rosacea is a common chronic facial dermatologic disorder in children. However, no standardized therapy exists for its treatment. Dapsone is an effective treatment for acne and dermatologic conditions without significant adverse effects. Its efficacy and safety have been demonstrated in adults with rosacea, but little is known about its effects in children. To assess the clinical efficacy and safety of a dapsone 0.1% gel in a patient population with rosacea. Patients were randomized to apply dapsone 0.1% gel once daily over the forehead and/or cheeks for 2 months. Efficacy measures were the physician's global assessment (0-4) and child patient and investigator global assessments. Adverse events were assessed weekly. One hundred twenty children were randomized into 2 arms, with 60 children per arm. The groups had comparable demographics and baseline characteristics. At the end of 2 months of therapy, there was a statistically significantly greater reduction in the physician's global assessment scores in all 3 of the study areas in the dapsone 0.1% arm than the vehicle arm (P <.05). There was no statistically significant difference in the overall pediatric patient or investigator global assessment scores between the 2 arms at the end of the study. Treatment was well tolerated. Dapsone 0.1% gel used short-term (2 months) was well tolerated and has the potential benefits of reduction of symptoms for an extended period and reduced erythema. The overall efficacy and safety of the treatment are comparable with a marketed formulation containing dapsone 0.1% gel in adults without evidence of enhanced efficacy or systemic effects in a child population.

1. Field of the Invention
The present invention relates to novel aqueous pigment-solution printing inks and compositions for use therewith. More specifically, the present invention relates to aqueous pigment-solution printing inks having an improved water balance and to the compositions useful therewith.
2. Description of the Prior Art
Pigment-solution printing inks have the property that they can be used in the presence of water. More specifically, since they must be present at some stage during the printing process, aqueous pigment-solution inks are typically present in a substantially stable form.
However, due to their water content, these printing inks require certain precautions and controls to ensure the quality of the finished product. If they are not properly processed and shipped, they will cause a reduction in the image quality of the finished paper. On the other hand, if the inks are kept in an open system, they may cause a condition known as "cockling" in the final image, or may cause the printed images to shrink excessively during drying. Also, as a consequence of their water content, aqueous pigment-solution inks are less stable than other types of ink, and can suffer from coagulation if left on a surface after drying.
The pigment which is used in the aqueous pigment-solution inks typically contains a binder polymer. The binder polymer is typically a polymer of a monomer having a low molecular weight such as a low molecular weight aldehyde (e.g. a dimethylol propionic aldehyde) having a number average molecular weight of under 100,000; a reactive diluent which is inert upon admixture to the pigment and which does not react with the binder polymer; and additives such as wetting agents, defoamers, plasticizers, rheology modifiers and the like.
Pigment-solution printing inks are typically formulated by a mixture of the aqueous components which are necessary to properly control the printing process including, but not limited to, wetting agents, wetting control assistants, film formation assistants, defoamers, rheology modifiers, defoaming assistants, and a diluent. When you are ready to start with Step 1, mix up your delicious fruit or vegetable or fruit and vegetable flavor. What can I add to make my pop especially tasty? A key point of the bill is that it does not require that the government force service providers to comply with a new mandate. Instead, government can direct service providers to comply with the new requirements. The committee did recommend that the government require internet service providers to block websites that appear to be used for the distribution or exchange of child pornography.

Another example is the prohibition that the committee wants that prohibits an Internet access provider from blocking lawful content with some degree of specificity. There is an ambiguity as to what might be construed as lawful content: it could be just any content that is on the list. As it stands now, any content that the government does not find a legal reason not to block is a legal matter.

Another point the committee made is that in order to comply with a law enforcement order to disable access to content, service providers would need to notify the user and give them notice and an opportunity to opt out of being affected by the order. There are no requirements for the service provider to give this information to the individual and without the protection of individual rights to due process, there is no question that the business of service providers will be affected by law enforcement agencies.

The bill does contain a good measure of privacy protections for both service providers and consumers. The bill would prohibit the government and third-party business entities from accessing a customer’s stored data without warrant or a court order. There are provisions that would allow the courts to set reasonable limits to the duration, timing and frequency when data may be accessed.

Finally, the bill has a good set of provisions that give protection to customers when data is shared with a third-party for business purposes.

While the bill is not perfect, it will likely be better than much of what was discussed last session.

The bill was introduced by Ron Kind, D-Wisconsin, and was co-signed by six additional Republicans and two Democrats.

There are eight Republican cosponsors this session and the bill is set to have a hearing March 9.

Growing up I was introduced by some other lucky kid to "Shakedown Street", "Cassidy" and "Riverside". I've been a die-hard fan ever since. And I consider myself pretty fucking lucky to be in the right place right now to be experiencing their reissue campaign.

I think there are different things that make a band special. They aren't always as obvious in a band like Phish. So I am going to try to rank what I consider the '10 Deads of the New Era' according to that criteria:

Best Live Show. This one is easy. The Dead performed the best on stage with a lot of their best tunes. They played for almost three and a half hours. I can't think of one single song from that era that has lived up to the hype of this show. It was that good. I'll add that there are many other live shows in that era that were good. But not this one. I have never seen this band perform this well. It was perfection. One of the best things you could ask a band to do over the years. This was the pinnacle. It is the one that made them a rock star. If they never played again and disappeared off of the stage, the dead legacy would still be as strong and still be heard. This was the show that made it happen.

Best Song. Easily this one again. I will go back in time and rank all the songs they performed here, but it is a pretty good list to be honest. A perfect setlist from the second night. A few of them are among the all-time ones. But there are others. "Jack Straw" may not be as well known as some songs. But from a live context its transcendental. It would be just as good if we saw Jerry on the drums for this one. "Casey Jones" has a place in history and the dead legacy is stronger when viewed from this perspective. But if we hear this song, we think of this show. And when we think of this show, it is remembered more fondly.

Best Box. The fact that the box for this show has been signed makes it even more prized, as well as being signed by the band. I like box that has the band's signatures on the front, but this is like icing on the cake.

Best Recording

Q:

Is there an elegant way to make an iterator over an array of tuples?

I'm looking for an elegant way to make an iterator in Haskell that walks through a list of tuples, like this: 
[("A", 1), ("B", 2), ("C", 3), ("D", 4)]

and returns
[("A", 1), ("B", 2), ("C", 3), ("D", 4)]

rather than
[["A",1], ["B",2], ["C",3], ["D",4]]

I came across the following but it doesn't work. 
iterate :: (a -> a) -> [a] -> [a] 
iterate f = go [] f
  where
    -- go last tail = last
    go last rest = go (last:rest) rest

A:

Use traverse, it's the right function.
>>> import Data.Traverse
>>> traverse id [("A",1), ("B",2), ("C",3), ("D",4)]
[("A",1),("B",2),("C",3),("D",4)]

It's just traverse id applied to a list.
It might be nice to add a comment there so it's clear it's id. This doesn't compile with your specific example, though, because id :: a -> a.

Mucosal-associated invariant T cells are not required for protection against Pseudomonas aeruginosa infection in the intestine.
We have previously shown that protection provided by mucosal immunization against Pseudomonas aeruginosa was mediated by protective CD4+ T cells which expressed both the alpha and beta receptors of the T-cell receptor (TCR). The majority of these cells were Vk-23 transgenic splenocytes and were therefore mucosal associated invariant T (MAIT) cells. We sought to use mice bearing a deletion mutation in the beta-chain variable region of their TCR to determine whether MAIT cells played a role in the immune response to P. aeruginosa infection in the lung. In contrast to our previous results, we found here that P. aeruginosa infection of MAIT cell knockout (Jalpha281(-/-)) mice was not less resistant than that of control mice and that bacterial counts were not reduced in the BALF of infected Jalpha281(-/-) mice when compared with control littermates. The absence of a difference in resistance to P. aeruginosa infection between Jalpha281(-/-) mice and wild-type mice indicates that MAIT cells are not required for the immune response in the lungs to this bacterial pathogen.

Nina Vestergaard

Nina Vestergaard (née Kastrup, 23 January 1884 – 15 May 1969) was a Danish nurse and politician, who after World War II was Minister for Social Security in a series of coalition cabinets. With her husband Ole Vestergaard, she was the mother-in-law of Jens Otto Krag

Early life and education
Nina Louise Kastrup was born in  Rungsted, Jutland, a daughter of farmer Hans Kastrup (1841–1926) and Maria Elisabeth (1850–1943), née Tietz. She had five siblings. She married Ole Vestergaard (1859–1927), a grocer, on 29 December 1904.

Career
Together with her husband, she belonged to the Danish People's Party, and during World War I, from 1917 to 1919, she worked as a nurse. In 1927, she was elected to North Jutland County Council. A few years later, when the Danish People's Party lost the elections, she remained in the County Council and in 1938, she became deputy chairperson of this body. She became a member of the Danish Parliament's Second Chamber in 1926 and of the First Chamber in 1936. From 1933 to 1934 and from 1934 to 1935, she was a member of the Danish delegation in the International Labour Organization.

During the Danish resistance to Nazi Germany, she was engaged as a nurse on the Eastern Front where she treated Danish-manned and -staffed convoys. This was a dangerous occupation as it was possible that the convoys she was with might be stopped and searched at any time.

After the war, Vestergaard belonged to the Danish delegation in the United Nations Economic Sub-Commission. After an agreement was made with the Soviet Union, she was sent to Moscow as a delegate on behalf of the Danish Union of Building Trade Employees and was in 1950 appointed delegate by the Nordic Employers' Council to the Social Security Committee. She became Danish Minister for Social Security from 26 May 1951 to 1 November 1953, and a member of the central committee of the Danish Confederation of Trades Unions from 1952 to 1959. After a conflict between the Danish People's Party and the Danish Union of Building Trade Employees, Vestergaard was ousted from the Danish Cabinet and replaced with Hans Børring in 1953. Since 1953, she was no active in politics. She died in Vejle on 15 May 1969 and

Solitary reticulohistiocytoma of the parietal scalp with no recurrence during 10 yr of follow-up.
A solitary papulonodular lesion on the scalp of a 40-yr-old female patient grew slowly. Histological findings showed round-to-oval and vacuolated histiocytes with mild atypia, surrounded by a thin fibrous wall with dense vascular proliferation. There was no evidence of malignancy. The solitary papulonodular lesion resolved during 5 yr of follow-up, without recurrences. Solitary reticulohistiocytomas may be considered a cutaneous counterpart of reticulohistiocytomas of bone (multiple), soft tissue, and the nervous system.

The invention relates to a system for the separation of carbon dioxide from a gas stream, or for the production of a carbon-dioxide-containing product and is based upon WO 2008/077969 A1.
In the known system, which is also known by the name “TRAX™ technology”, the gas stream which is to be supplied with CO2 is first of all conducted, to a first stage of an absorption column containing an aqueous solution of urea or ammonia, which forms a urea or ammonia dialkali metal carbonate being highly concentrated. The gaseous hydrocarbon stream is freed from the aqueous solution and the hydrocarbon-air gas mixture is conducted as a product gas to a second stage of a CO2 absorption column (see WO 08/077969 A1; FIGS. 1 and 2).
At the second stage, a circulating aqueous ammonia or urea solution absorbs CO2 from an external air stream, by chemical conversion of urea (CH4N2O2) or ammonia NH3) to carbonates. The CO2-contaminated solution is supplied by a pump in a recirculation circuit to the first stage of the absorption column, and is separated thereupon from a part of the circulating ammonia or urea solution which is freed from CO2 and recirculated in addition to a part of the ammonia or urea solution which is recycled for the absorption of CO2 in the first stage. The aqueous solution which is recycled for the absorption of CO2 at the first stage contains, at most, 5.5% by volume of ammonium carbamate and in the second stage is additionally at least 95% depleted of CO2. In such a manner, a liquid stream containing CO2 is formed, which is transferred from the second stage to a regeneration column and to a storage tank for CO2 for the formation of an aqueous alkali metal carbonate solution.
Although an arrangement of this type for the recovery of CO2 leads to energy savings of approximately 8 to 10% compared to known prior art, it still has considerable disadvantages. Depending on the configuration, depending on the application, the required flow rate, etc., in the recirculation circuit for the recovery of CO2 can be reduced considerably. This results in an increase in the energy required for the CO2-recovery section and for the CO2 regeneration, which cannot be covered even by a combination of various approaches so far

The policy could lead to the forcible removal of a parent from a child in the country without due process or the consent of the U.S. government, a violation of international law and human rights experts.

ADVERTISEMENT

The plan, revealed Tuesday, puts a greater financial and legal burden on already overburdened migrant shelters to deal with what advocates say are the children of migrants who crossed the border illegally.

It also sends the unenviable position of government officials to those on the frontlines of enforcing an immigration policy that President Trump Donald John TrumpBiden leads Trump by 36 points nationally among Latinos: poll Trump dismisses climate change role in fires, says Newsom needs to manage forest better Jimmy Kimmel hits Trump for rallies while hosting Emmy Awards MORE argues unfairly targets migrants crossing the border illegally.

A number of child welfare advocacy groups have condemned the president’s plans.

But some Republicans have also raised concerns about the policy, and it’s unclear if it will gain traction in Congress with the midterm elections approaching.

The plan follows a week of chaos at the border. On Friday, the Trump administration announced it was ending a program that protects migrant families who have crossed the border from seeking asylum.

On Monday, the president signed an executive order that prevents undocumented migrants from seeking asylum in the U.S. unless they first sought protection in one of the countries they passed through before reaching the border.

And in early April, immigration agents attempted to round up hundreds of undocumented migrants at a facility in Murrieta, Calif., after their attorneys filed papers to halt a court-ordered migrant shelter that could see 2,000 children separated from their parents.

In announcing the plan on Tuesday, Acting Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Secretary Kevin McAleenan said the government would no longer keep undocumented children in long-term migrant shelters.

“In the past we have kept families together,” McAleenan said in remarks at a White House press conference on Tuesday. “The family separation policy at the border became a symbol for what was happening at the southern border, and for many, many months we have been trying to find a legislative solution to address this issue.”

But

how to use nim and python together for a project

python for a windows application...

A:

Nim and Python are programming languages, like C++ and Java. The language does what it says on the tin. The same as they do on a C++ program, Nim and Python languages do what they say on the tin.
The idea of using both Nim and Python is that you can program the Linux part of your application using Nim, and the windows part using Python. They both do the same thing on their own, only the two languages are different.
What you need is a cross-platform programming, which means to use only one programming library or only one programming language which do both the jobs. Some of those frameworks are: WxWidgets, Qt, GTK+, Gtkmm, FLTK. You pick what's best to use. Here is a very useful link:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/407638/choosing-cross-platform-framework
The good thing about writing your application using Nim is that many people already made libraries and tools for it. Here are some examples:

http://github.com/nimhacking/nim-gui-examples
https://github.com/nimhacking/nim-tutorial
https://github.com/nimhacking/nim-nrepl
nimhacking/nim-nrepl-example

To use it, just import in your Nim modules with #import "nimhacking/nim-gui-examples", etc, or just make a nimhacking.nim file to use it:
use "//nimhacking/nim-gui-examples//src/nimhacking.nim" name gui

import gui (import std.datetime)

var now = new DateTime.now()
var m = now.milliseconds() / 1000 // get microseconds

/* now is = DateTime(2017, 10, 8, 10

Brasília difícil de se tornar. O Governo, na tentativa de consolidação, criou uma lista de 15 ministérios que devem ser rebaixados até setembro do ano que vem, mas quem não sabe que isso está acontecer já não pode entrar na capital e dar as costas para as águas da República. Assim é visto na administração federal e pelo que o “Correio” sabe, o ministro da Esporte, Leonardo Picciani, teria alertado o presidente da República nesta segunda-feira que está acabando as portas para os candidatos.

No ‘Correio do Poder’, nomeado por Temer, a avaliação é que Picciani está deixando claro que é preciso ter cuidado. O ministro recebeu algumas propostas nas reuniões da chefia, mas, mesmo em um ambiente de colisão nos braços do Governo, não dá trégua.

Picciani desconhece qualquer movimento de rejeição de candidaturas que estão na lista de 15 e, até o ano que vem, não será liberado mais nomeações. Segundo o ministro, é muito difícil deixar de entrar no ranking, assim como é preciso saber que, às vezes, esses 15 ministérios atendem e outras são mantidos.

Picciani tem, ainda, alertado que deve haver um órgão de fiscalização, com base no Decreto nº 9.504, capítulo IV, do de 12.12.2015. Esse órgão será responsável por verificar a situação dos quesitos técnicos relativos à qualificação dos ministérios definidos nos respectivos decretos.

The present invention relates to a digital phase locked loop (PLL) with a fractional division of a clock signal.
PLL circuits or "frequency synthesizers" are well known as one of the most important and widely used electronic circuits. As the demand for digital data transmission systems and systems with high speed interfaces has increased, integrated circuit PLL circuits have been developed to provide a high frequency phase lock and frequency multiplication function for the output of a reference oscillator to provide a local clock for a synchronous integrated circuit and other purposes.
As known in the art, a PLL circuit requires a reference clock signal for its operation. At the same time, it is highly desirable for the PLL circuit to be able to generate a division-free clock signal to operate a synchronous integrated circuit, which is generally referred to as a "clock" signal.
It is particularly desirable to have a clock signal that has a fractional frequency, i.e., a clock signal that has a variable frequency which is controlled by a digital data input signal that may be varied between 0 and "1" during each PLL feedback loop cycle, or the reference oscillation cycle. Unfortunately, the prior art does not provide a circuit which is capable of meeting such a requirement. Also, many applications require the PLL looping frequency to be independent of the reference oscillator's output to remain stable over variations of the power supply as is commonly the case. Moreover, it will be appreciated that any fractional division of the incoming data may result in phase and frequency errors. Prior art PLL circuits typically do a coarse frequency division (i.e., div=1) to provide a desired PLL looping frequency independent of frequency fluctuations and do finer frequency division to decrease the total phase and frequency error associated with the coarse division, but they do not consider further reduction of the phase and frequency errors.
Several PLL circuits that can provide a fractional division have been developed. Examples include U.S. Pat. No. 4,749,917 to Asano et al., U.S. Pat. No. 4,928,038 to Nakawa et al. and U.S. Pat. No. 4,823,056 to Yamada. All of these patents suffer from the lack of precise temperature stability of the loop filter capacitors of the PLL circuits, resulting in unacceptable phase and frequency offsets. Other examples are U.S. Pat. No. 4,543,530 to Takano

1. Field of the Invention
The present invention relates to a liquid developer used for developing electrostatic latent images formed on an electrophotographic photoconductor and more particularly, to a liquid developer which is excellent in dispersibility, fluidity, and the quality of solid particles and which can attain both high density and high image quality.
2. Discussion of Background
As shown in FIG. 1, a conventional liquid developer used for developing latent images formed on an electrophotographic photoconductor has a carrier liquid A consisting of kerosene having dispersed therein pigment particles B suspended in a non-aqueous liquid medium. Such carriers are classified into inorganic carrier particles and organic carrier particles. Aqueous solutions (including micro-capsules and micro-emulsions) containing inorganic or organic pigment particles are used as well. Further, they are available in the form of dispersions having a particle diameter of several dozens of microns to 1,000 microns.
In order to cause the liquid pigment particles dispersed in carrier liquid A to come close to the surface of the non-aqueous carrier liquid, and also to prevent the particles from moving in a shear field and in the absence of a stabilizer by the stirring of the carrier liquid, it has been proposed in U.S. Pat. No. 4,546,060 to use a cationic or non-ionic colloid dispersing agent having a long hydrocarbon chain having a HLB value of 11 or more. However, a conventional technique using a cationic colloid dispersing agent is defective in that only non-ionic ones are soluble in the carrier liquid and this makes it impossible to control the charge characteristics of the liquid developer which is to be achieved by the addition of a specific inorganic or organic pigment.
On the other hand, JP-A-63-222217 proposes a carrier liquid containing a dispersion of a monomer or modified monomer polymer. These carrier liquids are mainly used for a purpose of achieving high speed recording.
A conventional technique for controlling the charge of the carrier liquid having dispersed the pigment particles is not capable of imparting a stable charge amount to the carrier liquid to be circulated after development. Further, the dispersion of pigment particles in the carrier liquid causes the particles to sediment and adhere to the surface of the apparatus or to the surface of the electrophotographic photoconductor where the liquid developer is applied thereon for development. 1. Field of the Invention
The invention relates to the field of networked computer systems and, more specifically, to computer systems with multiple processor types, such as a client and a server in the network.
2. Description of the Related Art
Computer systems often are configured to have a client portion, a server portion, and a switching portion or switching network that interconnects the client portion and the server portion. In these systems or environments, the client portion is capable of executing programs for carrying out data manipulations and transactions. The server portion executes programs to service client requests. The switching network provides network routing services between clients and servers. In general, the client portion may be made up of some number of logical, virtual, or logical/virtual machines distributed across one or more physical machines. Typically, the client portion contains a physical processor that is capable of carrying out processing operations in response to network requests. In such arrangements, the number of such logical/virtual machines may be greater than the number of the physical machines. In some cases, each logical/virtual machine may also have some number of logical processors or logical threads and may be physically located on a different physical or logical machine. Alternatively, each logical/virtual machine may represent a discrete entity, such as a service or group of services, that may be provided within one or more physical machines operating in parallel to one another.
In any of these environments, a host application, or thread may execute in one of the logical, virtual, or logical/virtual machines. Some systems may include several types of application execution. For example, a client may have a server in a server environment, client applications, such as browser applications (e.g. http, html), a web server, and e-mail server applications. A browser application may contain web pages that are accessed by other browser applications in client computers (e.g. http, html, applets). A web server application may contain web pages that are accessed by other client applications (e.g. http, html, and applet); web server applications may be part of a web server or a web sever agent that contains many http, html, and applet applications. A message server application may operate within a web server, browser applications, and can use http or a https protocol. A mail application may be a server application or part of an application that is associated with an e-mail server.

This invention relates to a high intensity electric discharge lamp such as a fluorescent lamp, and more particularly to an electrodeless bulb for high intensity discharge lamps which uses at least two halogen-containing low pressure filling materials.
The high intensity discharge lamps (HID) includes all types of electric discharge lamps that are utilized for general lighting applications, but have an output power of at least 400 watts, and most have an output of 500 watts or greater. Various metal halide vapor lamps, such as those disclosed in U.S. Pat. No. 4,834,395 issued May 30, 1989, to R. G. Barratt and U.S. Pat. No. 4,900,014 issued on Feb. 13, 1990 to D. E. Paulus et al., are known to those skilled in the art. In recent years, HID lamps, in particular metal halide lamps, are being used for a variety of applications in order to replace the more conventional and well-known incandescent lamps. One such application is in the area of headlamps for motor vehicles, as described in U.S. Pat. Nos. 4,898,200; 5,055,760; and 5,041,849.
Although metal halide lamps do offer advantages over conventional incandescent lamps, there are several problems associated with such lamps. First of all, conventional low-pressure metal halide lamps have very low light output efficiency when compared to those of conventional incandescent lamps. In addition, while metal halide lamps generate light of only one or two discrete wavelengths, such as sodium light-emitting at 589.3 nanometers, metal halide lamps are limited in their choice of colors and cannot provide the broader spectrum for most light applications. Furthermore, because metal halide lamps operate at much higher pressures, (typically pressures greater than 100 torr), such lamps tend to contain mercury and when they fail, present a potential health threat.
Thus, there is a need for an electrodeless lamp with an efficiency comparable to metal halide lamps while maintaining relatively lower mercury vapor pressure.

Gastric ulcers in patients hospitalized for acute chest syndrome.
The purpose of this study is to describe the proportion of patients hospitalised for acute chest syndrome (ACS) with gastric ulcer disease in the Netherlands, and to establish the factors for which their management remains suboptimal. The data on the causes of acute chest syndromes and the management of patients hospitalised were collected from a nationwide study that is carried out routinely by the hospital health service. Among the 483 patients, 41 (8.4%) patients were recorded as having had a gastric ulcer, compared with 9.1% in the Dutch population of hospitalised patients in the time period 1990-2002. Among patients with cardiac arrhythmia and myocardial infarction and shock, the gastric ulcer was the second most common diagnosis after ACS. Mortality was 28%. Treatment that was not considered appropriate in at least 50% of patients, included acid-suppressive therapy, treatment with a proton pump inhibitor (PPI), and the use of antacids. This study shows that the number of patients hospitalised for ACS with a gastric ulcer was high and that this ulcer was also responsible for considerable morbidity and mortality. Our findings suggest that most of ACS patients treated in the Netherlands with a gastric ulcer were not optimally treated.

Are you allowed to get one-time pad code on a CD or DVD?

Can you get the one-time pad code off a one time used DVD or CD? 
Are there any limitations on the distribution of said code?
Can you have multiple copies of it?

A:

In principle yes, that's what the one-time pad is. In practice you'd have to read out the code and write it back before you could use it. DVDs and CDs with a code burned in are useless.
If you want to play around with real one-time pad and don't want to use any other materials, you'd have to write it on an harddisk. If you need a lot of different one-time pads you could also create an virtual harddisk, containing all different values you need. This has some benefits against hardware storage because it's possible to destroy the disk and still keep the data on it. You just cannot read out the data off the disk, unless you want to recreate the virtual harddisk. 
However, it is not easy to keep a lot of different one-time pads for different use cases, since you need a lot of different keys for the different types of input or use cases, and that would make the harddisk quite large and quite difficult to handle.
The solution for most people that aren't in the intelligence community is probably a software one-time pad. You could use software as a one-time pad, by using key files, not only a full one-time pad. If you still want to do it by hand, however, you will need a lot of different codes in a large format, which is a lot of codes. A standard hard disk is just too small.

Estrone 3-oxo-reductase activity changes with growth conditions: enzymatic kinetic characteristics.
We have investigated the effect of growth phase on the specific activity of estrone 3-oxo-reductase in cultured MCF-7 human breast tumor cells. The specific activity of estrone 3-oxo-reductase at 24 h increases from a value of 7 +/- 2 pmol/min per mg protein (mean +/- standard deviation) to 25 +/- 4 pmol/min per mg protein at 96 h. The increase in 3-oxo-reductase specific activity at 24 h was inhibited by the inclusion of D-ribose in the growth medium. At 96 h, the specific activity decreased to 13 +/- 3 pmol/min per mg protein in the presence of D-ribose. The D-isomer of ribose significantly blocked the increase in 3-oxo-reductase activity at 24 h by 37% and did not have any effect in the steady-state level of the enzyme. These results suggest that changes in the intracellular redox state as the result of changes in growth conditions may determine the specific activity of estrone 3-oxo-reductase.

The "Fringe" stars are getting a holiday treat, with the season four premiere airing on April 22 on Fox.

There will be lots of family time at the Fringes when "Fringe'" returns to Fox April 22. (Fox)

There have been plenty of changes in the Fringe-verse since the third season finale.

When it returns after a three-month hiatus, the "Fringe" series will find the heroes battling a new nemesis: the Replicators.

In the present day, the Fringe team's efforts to stop the replication of an enemy have turned into an all-out battle to save the world from an extinction level event.

If the premiere is any indication, the show will keep up its high level of creepy goodness.

Watch a preview of the premiere, below.

The original "Fringe"

For its second go-round, the show seems to have changed its creative approach. The new cast has been welcomed to the series with open arms and there has been a new tone that is more sci-fi adventure than paranormal battle. But it hasn't lost its sense of scary creepiness.

The premiere is also the first to feature William Shatner as the Man in Black and Leonard Nimoy as Walter Bishop. The two showrunners, Alex Kurtzman and Roberto Orci, also wrote the third-season finale, which they wrote at the same time they were writing the series finale for the original "Fringe" series.

"The fans wanted this and it was something that we felt was more ambitious and would live up to what Alex and Roberto set up for us," said showrunner Jeff Pinkner, in a recent news release.

Pinkner noted that the season 3 finale was called a season-long cliffhanger after fans demanded answers, and he says they plan to deliver more answers and a series that is worthy of those answers.

He went on to say, "We are so excited to see this episode into the world because from the first time we read it we couldn't wait to see people react to the episodes that are coming down the pipeline."

To prepare fans for the upcoming season premiere, Fox has released its first teaser for the second season. The clip, below, contains plenty of clues for the upcoming plot and it's safe to say that the series will continue to stay mysterious and, yes, creepy.

Exporting data from Access to Excel

I am trying to export a table from Access to excel.  I have followed many tutorials and read online tutorials but I have not been able to export anything.  I am using access 2010/2013 

A:

If you're using Jet/ACE,
DoCmd.TransferSpreadsheet acExport, TableName, xlsxformat, "SOMEXPORT.xlsx", True

If you're using DAO,
Dim conn As ADODB.Connection
Dim rs As ADODB.Recordset
Dim xlsxformat As String

Set conn = CreateObject("ADODB.Connection")
conn.Open "Provider=Microsoft.ACE.OLEDB.12.0;Data Source=" & Application.CurrentProject.Path & "\" & "SOMEXPORT.xlsx"

Set rs = CreateObject("ADODB.Recordset")
rs.Open "Select * From SOMEXPORT.xlsx", conn, adOpenKeyset, adLockOptimistic

rs.Close

How to store multiple variables in a list to be used in a for loop

I have 3 lists that should all be looped through in a for loop - one that starts at a value and ends at 4 with increments of 1. Then from number 4 onwards there's a 0 incrementation until the 3rd list ends.
So at first i will start at a value of 0 and end at a 4; then increments after that. I wanted to store a value in this list on each iteration.
My problem is, I have no idea how to store a value in the list on each iteration and add the value to the list. Does anyone have an idea?
a = [2,3,5,6,8]' #should be 10 but would like to store all values in a list

for x in a:
    print(x)

A:

In addition to storing the number you can use a list comprehension with enumerate.
a = [2,3,5,6,8]
print([i + 1 for index, i in enumerate(a) if i >= 4])
# => [5]

MySql : How to get latest row id from last 5 days in a table

I have a mysql table with fields :
user_id                     data_sourceid                 timestamp
I want to get latest row id from 5 days back and user_id in this row is used for next query.
For example, if I run this query :
select * from user_timeline where status = '1' and timestamp 
between 1517394530 AND 15175630;

I want this query to get latest row id which is 1517394530 for the above query. 
Can you please guide me how to do query and let me know if I am using in correct way. 

A:

To get record for last 5 days try using below query:
SELECT user_id FROM user_timeline 
WHERE timestamp > timestamp - INTERVAL 5 DAY
ORDER BY timestamp DESC
LIMIT 1;

In vitro synthesis and secretion of immunoglobulin by murine splenic and blood mononuclear cells.
A previously described in vitro technique for the production of immunoglobulin by the human monocyte-macrophage system was used to study the response of murine mononuclear cells with various subpopulations to various stimuli. In normal spleen, purified mononuclear cells were stimulated by the mitogens Concanavalin A and PHA, by the tumor-associated antigens, IEF and CEA and by lipopolysaccharide. Stimulation of splenic cells by PHA resulted in the greatest amount of immunoglobulin production and stimulation by Concanavalin A, although significant, was less than that of PHA. The CEA specific T-cell population responded more vigorously to CEA stimulation than did the non-T population. Stimulation of purified blood mononuclear cells with PHA resulted in a negligible amount of detectable Ig. Concanavalin A was, again, the most effective stimulator of mononuclear cells from blood.

The invention relates to a device for the rotary adjustment of the position of the driving axis of a gas-measuring instrument relative to a stationary reference which at its axial end is pivotally connected with the housing of the device containing the gas-measuring instrument, the housing comprising an element which is pivotal or pivotable relative to the stationary reference about a first axis, said element carrying the driving axis.
Such a device is for instance known in the form of a positioner for a gas-measuring instrument, such as a concentration meter for measuring the concentration of a gas in a gas-liquid mixture, and comprises a housing which is rotatively attached to a fixed reference, e.g. a wall. The gas-measuring instrument is arranged in the housing which serves to transfer all rotary movements of the instrument to the housing, in order to make it pivotable when it carries a second axis of rotation about a pivotal (axis of rotation) on the reference. The pivotal axis represents the driving axis for the gas-measuring instrument.
The pivotal axis is pivotally connected to a shaft which is rotatably held in the housing. The latter shaft, in turn, is formed by an elongate element, which comprises the shaft and an adjacent portion of the housing which serves to guide rotary movements of the shaft from the housing to the pivotal axis and vice versa. In the same way the housing serves to provide a driving force for rotary movements of the shaft (element) as a result of the relative rotation between the housing and the reference. On the other hand the elongate member serves to provide a mechanical coupling between the housing and the reference in order to ensure that the housing remains stationary relative to the fixed reference.
In order to allow the gas-measuring instrument to be connected to a measuring line, there is provided in the housing a first orifice (i.e. opening) which can be connected, via a coupling (clamp) with a further orifice in the wall to which the measuring line is connected via a further orifice, and thereby to enable a gas to flow from the mixture of the liquid and gas through the measuring line to the measuring instrument. Typically, the measuring line is connected in a conventional manner with a further orifice in the wall to which a hose is connected via a hose coupler. 1. Field of the Invention
The invention relates to a novel method of controlling the process of the recovery of oil, gas and mineral matter from subterranean strata at temperatures below that at which the fluids are gaseous, the fluids being produced from boreholes at the bottom of such strata by the process of hydraulic fracturing. The invention consists in the use of water-soluble polymers as proppant materials. There is thereby produced a more rapid and more complete closure of the permeability channels and a greater quantity of material is held in suspension in the fluids at the surface of the earth. The method of the invention is to be distinguished in principle from those known by the general term of the "fracturing" process, although the method and material are the same in essential respects.
2. Description of the Prior Art
Oil fields have long been exploited by pumping water into the wells at the bottom of the earth and recovering the oil by pumping it to the ground surface. The principal cause of depletion of the fields and of the rise in the cost of the process is the viscosity of the oil which resists the passage of the water and oil through porosity in the rock. A number of processes has been developed, which reduce this viscosity. A process of very wide applicability which includes hydraulic fracturing has been brought into general use by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers. This requires the injection of water into the rock at a pressure sufficient to overcome the resistance of the rock structure of the formation. The injection and its consequences are accompanied by the migration of particles which fill the pores and so reduce the resistance to the flow of the fluids and of their products. Particles of a very wide range of materials are used as proppants including quartz, carbon black, polystyrene fibers, glass beads, walnut shells, wood and the shells of diatoms.
The oil wells developed in recent years have the potential for the production of fluids and minerals from underground strata at lower temperatures than hitherto possible, the lower temperatures being necessary for the production of gas, which is more readily separated into its constituents when it is under pressure. When the gas is natural gas the pressure is comparatively low, of about 5 to 40 kilograms per square centimeter, while at the same time the temperature rises to as high as 200.degree. C. Hoyer on Friday agreed to a request by House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to send a formal impeachment inquiry to the Judiciary Committee.

The White House appeared largely blind-sided by the House move to impeach. On the day it began, the White House asked its teams in Congress to begin working on the response, which was first detailed by Mr. Pence on Monday. On Friday afternoon, the White House was drafting an official letter to withhold aid to Ukraine and had asked for support on the letter to Mr. Trump’s legal team at the Justice Department. None of that happened, according to officials.

The White House released the aid to Ukraine on Friday, the same day that Mr. Trump authorized a new package of military aid.

The House’s request to send the impeachment inquiry to three committees — Intelligence, Oversight and Foreign Affairs — was issued around 10:30 p.m. Friday and the formal request by Ms. Pelosi that the committee members turn over their investigation materials was sent to Judiciary at 7:35 p.m. Saturday.

Mr. Trump has resisted calls for an investigation into his actions with regard to Ukraine, arguing that such an inquiry would be a “witch hunt.” On Friday, amid the release of the aid to Ukraine, the president tweeted, “The Impeachment Hoax is just another Democrat Scam.”

Nucleic acids, oligosaccharides, and their interaction in plant organelles.
Cells in the green tissues of plants contain specialized cell organelles and structures, the functions of which are to serve as storage and trafficking sites for metabolic products. Nucleoids of different eukaryotes, especially plants, have been the focus of much recent interest, primarily due to their potential applications in biotechnology. These include the use of nucleolar proteins and ribonucleic acid (RNA) components in synthetic biology. An interesting feature of the nucleoid is its dynamic behavior in cells and tissues over a wide range of physiological situations. It is hypothesized that the dynamic behaviour of the nucleoid is due to the dynamic changes in structure that could be caused by a number of factors including: altered physiological states, various treatments, and interactions with cell components that carry out various functions. Structural alterations in nucleoids may affect the organization and/or functioning of the cell. Therefore, the nucleoidal dynamics may be of fundamental significance to cell function. The structure of plant cell organelles is not well studied, but the nucleoid is one of the most highly conserved features of eukaryotic cells. Because they are composed of nucleic acids and structurally very similar proteins, and are of vital importance to cells, it seems likely that nucleoid components that interact with many other cell compartments play a role in many cellular functions. For example, the nucleoid can change in response to physiological, environmental, and cell treatment conditions, and these changes can affect nucleoid organization and the structure of nucleolar components in a cell. The effect of the nucleoid on other cellular organelles is unknown. However, it is clear that the nucleoid and organells share proteins and other macromolecular complexes. This review will discuss the properties of organelles, and highlight the potential interactions between organelles. This includes the nucleoid and mitochondria, as well as the perinucleolar compartment, which has not been extensively studied. Finally, the role that the nucleoid has in cell division is discussed, and evidence is presented that shows that the nucleoid and nucleoli are involved in cell division.

The present invention relates to fuel injection systems and in particular to an injection nozzle for an externally fuel-injected engine that improves fuel atomization.
Injection nozzles generally include a needle valve which is closed by a spring force in the absence of a command to fire, and opened when a command for injection is generated by a cam lobe. A hollow spindle is attached near the bottom of the valve at one end, and an internal poppet is located between the spring and spindle, so that the needle is biased closed but can be forced outward by the action of the cam lobe against the spindle, causing it to pass outwardly through the hollow spindle and open the spray orifice at the top of the injector head. After fuel enters, the spring causes the needle to close by the force of its own return spring.
Nozzles that operate in this manner must be able to supply fuel to the cylinder reliably throughout the injection cycle. An important factor in the atomization of the injected fuel, which is essential for accurate timing, is the diameter of the spray orifice at the top of the injector head. This size determines the ratio of injector efficiency to required injector orifice size. The spray orifice diameter should generally be larger than the needle orifice to ensure efficient injection. Too large, and an excessive gap is formed between the needle and spray orifice, resulting in incomplete fuel filling and poor fuel atomization. Too small, and a back pressure builds which may result in incomplete injections.
The diameter of the orifice may be varied by changing the relative positions of the needle and spray orifice relative to each other. There are two main ways of providing this. One is to change the diameter of the spray orifice. This is accomplished by either redesigning the injector head to vary this size, or by providing a variable orifice. A variable orifice requires a mechanical linkage to move an orifice member in or out of the passage of the injector head. Variable orifices require constant adjustment, or they can result in variable fuel injection rate characteristics. In externally injected engines that operate on high pressure fuel such as the present day BMW inline-5 or Porsche 911 engines, there is no way to adjust the spray orifice diameter after the injector head is installed in the cylinder head of the engine, so that use of variable orifice nozzles is impractical.

The problem with views being more complex is that the methods to handle them are not documented in any documentation, they are internal, and thus developers may not know they exist and may not know that we can change something within them. What Does The Future Hold?

With a new presidential term in full swing and political promises flying around, everyone’s starting to ask — What does the future hold?

I recently attended a conference that addressed the future of the education field. We heard from speakers who came from across the world to share their perspectives on education, specifically as it pertains to our future. One of the core themes throughout was the idea of global citizenship and educating young people to be leaders, who understand that they are on this planet and are interdependent.

“In the past century, as governments grew and developed, education was the primary mechanism of global cooperation and the best indicator of the strength of a government,” said Ken Robinson, a celebrated speaker and a world-renowned academic who is now making his name as a cultural and social change catalyst. “But now we are faced with a global society with too many voices, too many ideas and nobody really knows what we are doing.” He went on to note the many gaps in our educational systems — gaps in our understanding of who we are and how we want to live alongside others.

“Our education systems are not equipped to provide enough common sense or self-awareness to deal with the challenge,” Robinson said. “And we are very ill-equipped, as well, to teach our children who we want to be.”

So with that in mind, how do we prepare our youth to lead a global nation? “Our job is to prepare them not to be good at one thing, but to be good at many things,” Robinson said. That’s his challenge to everyone in the education sector and the world overall. And what will be the outcome of this challenge?

Q:

What are the pros and cons of the old style inheritance?

I see the use of objects in the old style of inheritance still around.
I have read the arguments of the proponents.  Are there any other cons to inheritance using the classic OO paradigm?

A:

Pros:

It is easy to get your head around. See Wikipedia for a long list of the different types of inheritance found in practice.
It is a safe practice. It is only unsafe to inherit from a class in cases of the kind of circular inheritance that is discussed in other questions.
It does some of the job properly and is one of the most widely used styles.
Proxies and other tricks to get around the fact that they do not really provide inheritance can be tricky and it is easy to just have a class that is not an abstract class (but could behave like one).

Cons:

It is the only inheritance style that is completely non-descriptive. An interface has the same power as a pure abstract and it might be more useful when you get to that kind of problem.
The syntax of the language is not natural and can be confusing at first. One cannot think it is just the 'common' method of declaring an object to which you want others to inherit when he is in fact implementing a contract.
It has a reputation for being 'a bit of a mess'. But with such reputation comes great respect and it is widely used, so it must be right.

I see this style used pretty often when one is dealing with a language with a somewhat immature type system (see the above linked wiki).

A:

Pros:

You can inherit an interface, so in theory it's always extensible.

Cons:

The use of polymorphism makes the language difficult to read.
                                      (See http://peter.sh/experiments/is_this_a_polymorphic_object/

More recently I find the language does a pretty good job when it comes to letting you define object composition that would be difficult to define through other means.

A man from Tennessee has filed a lawsuit against his local school board and several school teachers who refused to let him enter his child's school on Election Day.

The school board members and school employees denied David Jones and the child in question safe access to the polling station on the basis that he was not a legal voter. Jones’s daughter was not old enough to vote in the 2016 election.

"David Jones was told he had to be a legal voter in order to his daughter's school to let him in," Mike Jones, David Jones’ father, said. "They said, 'No, I won't let him vote without his birth certificate or a state-approved voter registration card,' or some sort of document that would make him a legal voter, and that's just stupid, because who the hell's going to show that for David on Election Day?"

Jones’ attorney, Stephen Hayne, sent a letter Tuesday to the school board advising them to grant his client access to his child’s school on Election Day and "not create or attempt to create conditions for a different outcome."

Jones’s allegations are based on Tennessee election law, which has been interpreted to mean that a minor must be registered to vote and present a valid identity to enter a polling station. They argued that Jones was denied the proper documentation to do so, and therefore not allowed inside the school.

Hayne told The Christian Post that the school officials were not legally allowed to deny Jones access to the school because of the age difference. Though Hayne does not have a specific case for the court to review this week, he said, "There are cases in the past where courts held that individuals under the age of 14 cannot vote in the United States. And we would be asking the court to order the school board or the school to let David's children into school."

Because Jones is challenging the school’s decision on the basis that it was not allowed to deny the minor entry to the polling place on Election Day, they have three to six months to comply within the next eight, Hayne said.

The school’s policy on the issue is that the minor "may enter the school for only the purposes allowed by law" and would have to be accompanied by his or her parents or caregivers to ensure their safety.

Jones’ attorney argued that the school officials were acting beyond their jurisdiction when they refused Jones access to his daughter's school on Election Day.

The world's first digital library will open in France this week. Dubbed "Project Gallica," this electronic database of documents held in the collections of the Bibliothèque Sainte-Geneviève in Paris could be the most important resource on the web so far.

The project will collect information on everything from classical poetry to old French legal codes. "The goal is to take the best of the printed and manuscript heritage of France and all the world, and to make it the most comprehensive resource," says Catherine Noyer, the director of the project.

Noyer points to the Library of Alexandria in Egypt, which contains millions of scrolls collected from around the world. These ancient works were preserved in Alexandria thanks to the power of the pharaoh Ptolemy.

"He wanted the knowledge to survive and he wanted these documents to be available," Noyer says of Ptolemy. "He created the most amazing library that is in any way comparable to an Internet. It is a library without doors. You can go in, choose what you want, and leave."

As we heard last year at TED 2007, the same library's manuscripts would now be available digitally. "This project has the potential to be the first step towards giving the world access to the complete, electronic library of Alexandria," said Sir Tim Berners-Lee, the founder of the World Wide Web.

The project is a collaborative effort of the National Library of France, the Bibliothèque Nationale, Microsoft, the Centre National Inter-library Loan, and the National Library of Medicine. And just yesterday, the first major piece to go online was the French Civil Code of 1791, a legal document of importance given its influence on American law and copyright statutes.

The project has about 10 terabytes of material, or enough data to fill about 8 billion library books. It will take researchers about seven years to digitize the entire collection, which currently has 3 million documents including all of the best known work on classical literature, jurisprudence, medical manuscripts, and so on. "Most of the digitized material is in the Latin and Greek languages," Noyer says, but the project will eventually have content in "all the languages that have been the foundation of the French language." The first languages to be digitized will be French, English, Latin, German, Arabic, Persian and Chinese.

When all the documents are added to the online site there will be a separate area

An example of such a machine is described in the document FR-2 778 991 in the name of the applicant. The machine comprises a cutting tool whose tool head is constituted by a main portion provided in a rotary movement or swivelling axis and a removable cutting element whose tool bit can be put in position on the main portion of the tool head on the swivelling axis.
The tool is used to cut notches in tubular workpieces made of hard metal, in this instance a steel that is in particular to be cut by using laser beams.
It may happen that with the tool thus constituted it is necessary to make a certain number of the notches at the same time and this involves the tool having to be returned to the cutting position and then moved away, for the notches in which it is necessary to introduce new cutting elements and to remove those in which it is sufficient to proceed with maintenance work on the tool head.
It is thus of interest to have a device for managing tools of the kind indicated that allows such tools to be easily and rapidly returned to their cutting position, without giving rise to risk of loss of control of the tool during this movement, and subsequently to move away from the cutting position for maintenance operations. Additionally, the device should be very simple and particularly well adapted to facilitate rapid return of the tool to the cutting position.
