The present invention relates to a liquid container having an opening/closing means.
2. Description of the Related Art
Conventionally, most of the conventional water purifying apparatuses capable of purifying water from tap water by adding chemicals have a plurality of storage chambers (a water purifying liquid storing chamber or a liquid chamber) to store a plurality of kinds of purifying liquids (for example, water containing chemicals that are dissolved in water).
These kinds of water purifying apparatuses have the water purifying liquid stored in the water purifying liquid storing chamber or the liquid chamber of the storing container is purged by a pump and then supplied to each of a plurality of nozzles (for example, a tap). Therefore, when the nozzles are opened and/or closed, it is necessary to provide the water purifying liquid storing container with each of a plurality of closing members for opening and closing these nozzles. When a plurality of opening/closing means are provided, a space is required for each respective opening/closing means, which can cause a layout of the water purifying liquid storing container to be difficult. Furthermore, it is necessary to provide a plurality of pump driving means and also a plurality of switching means to switch the plurality of opening/closing means. Thus, a space is required for these opening/closing means, and consequently, a layout of the water purifying liquid storing container can become difficult (as a result, a large space is required for mounting, e.g., a pump on a water purifying apparatus). Also, it is necessary to provide an operation-driving mechanism for operating the plurality of opening/closing means. However, the operation of a large number of opening/closing means is complicated, which makes it difficult to provide an easy operation of the water purifying liquid storing container.
For example, the related apparatus is provided with a drive means (such as a motor) that can be driven into rotation for driving a plurality of opening/closing means provided on the water purifying liquid storing container.
For example, Unexamined Japanese Patent Application Publication No. 2004-342694 discloses a water purification apparatus that includes an introducing tube through which water is supplied to a water purifying agent supply device at its lower portion, a water purification agent pump for sucking water within the introducing tube and supplying the water as a treated water, a main tube (a water passage) formed

answer: A small-scale study in South Africa has found a link between HIV infection and the higher risk of developing dementia in later life. The researchers used data from a large, recent HIV epidemic for which the infection rate has been stable in a number of areas of South Africa since its beginning in the 1980s. They wanted to compare the onset of dementia between people who had been previously HIV-positive and those who had never had the virus. They looked at the records of over 11,000 HIV-positive women and over 17,000 women who had never been infected. “In this study we provide evidence that dementia is not only associated with HIV infection and AIDS but with increased risk of developing dementia in later life independently of the AIDS stage of HIV infection,” said study author Dr. Peter J. Wharam, of University of KwaZulu-Natal. He continued: “From the findings of this study, it appears that individuals with higher immunosuppression in the later years of infection have higher risk of developing dementia in later life.” The researchers, who presented the study findings at the Conference on Retroviruses and Opportunistic Infections this week in Boston, suggested that improving cognitive health and delaying dementia in people living with HIV might be achievable if HIV infection is managed differently. “We should work with the HIV infected population now who are in good health and prevent dementia if not already at significant risk,” Wharam concluded. “The results of this cohort should be considered with serious reservations in view of the retrospective nature of the study and the small sample size for an epidemiological study.” Study: Link Between HIV Infection and Increased Risk of Developing Dementia in Later Life was published in the International Journal of Infectious Diseases

The gunfire in the case — which occurred early Wednesday morning — did hit an officer. One of several rounds lodged into the officer’s bulletproof vest as he sat in his patrol vehicle waiting for backup.

“This is a tragic case,” Murphy told the San Francisco Examiner. “He didn’t think twice about shooting and damaging their equipment.”

As for why Washington — who was already on probation – was out past midnight drinking and doing drugs, Murphy said it wasn’t clear.

“It goes back a loooong time,” the lawyer said.

Washington has a history of violent tendencies. In one case, a woman charged him with two counts of domestic battery and he ended up being the victim. The other charges were later dismissed.

“During the course of police investigations, which included two of the SFPD on site, a search warrant was issued on the residence where my client resided to search for evidence of his activities,” Murphy said. “At the time of the raid, my client was on probation.”

A San Francisco police spokesman said he couldn’t comment on open investigations.

Washington has a long record of arrests for firearms violations and drugs. According to public records, he committed offenses as recently as April 17, 2009, when police found a loaded handgun on him and arrested him for possession of a firearm. He also had an outstanding arrest warrant.

The shooting suspect had a number of prior convictions for drug dealing. Most recent among them is a 2008 charge of possession with intent to sell cocaine in San Francisco Municipal Court.

In San Francisco Superior Court, he was charged in 2007 with possession of over an ounce of marijuana for sale, possession of a loaded firearm in a vehicle and possession of a loaded shotgun. He pleaded guilty to the weapons charges, his lawyer said.

Just one month prior to the San Francisco shooting, Washington was arrested in Oakland on Feb. 22 for possession

How to create a dataframe from a range of numbers based of a specific condition?

I have a list of numbers which varies from 200 to 20.
E.g.:
mylist = [200,301,400,501...]

I want to create a dataframe which looks like this:
ID    Start   End
200     300    500
201     700    800
...   .....  ...

I'm not sure how to do some manipulation.

A:

It looks to me like your values in your list are actually a datetime object. If that is the case, you can take advantage of the datetime library.
The data would have to be formatted thusly:
mylist = [datetime(year=2012, month=11, day=1), datetime(year=2012, month=12, day=1),...]

We can then do:
import datetime as DT
df = pd.DataFrame([[DT.datetime(year=mydatetime.year, month=mydatetime.month, day=mydatetime.day).replace(hour=0, minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0) for _ in range(len(mylist))] for mydatetime in mylist])

This gives us something like what you asked about:
        0       1        
0 2012-12-01 2012-12-01
1 2013-01-01 2013-01-01
2 2013-02-01 2013-02-01
3 2013-03-01 2013-03-01
4 2013-04-01 2013-04-01
5 2013-05-01 2013-05-01
6 2013-06-01 2013-06-01
7 2013-07-01 2013-07-01
8 2013-08-01 2013-08-01
9 2013-09-01 2013-09-01
10 2013-10-01 2013-10-01

Note, however, that the value of the 0 column is actually a datetime rather than your actual start/end numbers.
If you actually want the values in your original list you can do:
df = p

Predicting success after pediatric traumatic tracheobronchial self-expansion stents: a single-center cohort.
Tracheobronchomalacia (TBM), commonly treated with surgical tracheobronchoplasty (SBT) or tracheomalacia stents (TS), can be challenging to predict in small children. The aim of this study was to determine predictive factors for failure of tracheobronchial stents (TBS) to expand, using a retrospective single-center cohort. We analyzed medical and demographic variables between TBS success versus failure from May 2006 to December 2010. We compared pre and post-stenting variables, including stent-placement success, weight change, change in forced expiratory volume, change from the last visit prior to stenting to the last visit post-stenting, length of hospitalization, and complication rate. Univariate analysis was performed by independent t test or Mann- Whitney-U test, whereas logistic regression was used to assess multivariate risk factors for TBS failure. Forty-one TBSs were placed in 37 patients with a mean follow-up of 3.6 ± 1.9 months. Seventy percent (28/41) of patients had a history of SBT and 30% (12/41) had a history of SBT and prior TS placement. Twenty-two percent (9/41) of TSs failed due to airway obstruction at the carina (n = 2), stent extrusion (n = 5), or persistent or worsening symptoms of airway disease (n = 2). Univariate analysis of pre and post-stenting variables revealed no significant difference between TBS success and failure. In the multivariate analysis, none of the predictors for TBS success were statistically significant. TBS placement was not associated with significant complications (p = 0.56). No identifiable pre- or post-stenting predictors of TBS failure were identified. TBM in this cohort can be safely evaluated in children with and without prior surgical management using a standardized, low morbidity TS placement, with no discernible predictors for successful TBM management.

How do I determine the memory leak location of my program in C++

I'm trying to determine memory leak locations in my program. I'm using Microsoft Visual Studio 2017 community and X64. Whenever my program starts and runs in debug mode my memory use goes up but as I run my software, it eventually maxes out at 4GB and causes visual studio to run in the low memory errors. 
I'm trying to find what is keeping all this memory. Any ideas on how to go about this?

A:

A memory leak occurs when there is code or data that is allocated memory, but never gets freed by the program. When running at the lowest level of optimization (O2) (which is default) memory leaks are easier to identify.

Note this is only the initial allocation. After that you'd have pointers (statically or dynamically allocated) that can be freed later in your code (if you use smart pointers). But, if they aren't freed (because a memory leak occurs) you are looking at a cyclic reference.

There's no need to debug memory leaks if the code itself isn't broken. For this type of program (GUI/MFC/QT/Winforms) you should really look at the task manager. You want to see what applications are using a lot of memory. (Like your software or other software.)

If you use the heap, use the /NXCOMPAT /DEBUG:FATAL /INCREMENTAL switch in the Linker/Generate Debug info configuration. This will cause Visual Studio to always report memory leaks and to enable symbols for the debug heap. (Only use /DEBUG:FATAL if you know what you are doing.)

To help you find leaks, and in the process of memory debugging, I should mention this website. I used to use it a lot. I just learned to use the memory profile.
Visual Studio Memory Profiler Visual Basic
Visual Studio Memory Profiler Memory Analysis Tool

You can use various tools. Some of them are better because some have a command line application while others are just a GUI. I really think the VS debugger should come with a built-in memory profiler, however, it does not at this time. It would be great to see a "Memory Leak" debugger breakpoint!
I would suggest using the Visual Studio 2015 Memory Profiler as well and the Visual Studio 2017 Memory Profiler. There is

How to remove the last page from the PDF document in Python

I am using PDFmin to read a PDF file. Below is the code snippet I am using to achieve this
from pdfminer.pdfminer import PDFResourceManager, PDFPage
from PyPDF4 import PdfFileReader, PdfFileReader.TEXT
from pdfminer.pdfdocument import PDFDocument

manager = PDFResourceManager()
document = PDFDocument()

with PdfFileReader(file(f),"Text") as reader:
    document = manager.process_pdf(reader)

For some reason I get multiple pages in the PDF file. So if my document size is lets say 10 pages, I get a blank page between pages 9 and 10. How can I remove the last page from the PDF document?
Below is the sample output I have, I have tried removing the last page but still it is not getting removed. 
    6     #page 6
   07    #page 7
   08    #page 8
   09    
          09
_________

In this case in the PDF file the last page is the page number 9 and the blankspace before is the blank space before page number 9 in this case you would see the blank space for only page 9 not for page 8. So if I remove page 8 in the output then the file gets converted into this which is what I want:  
    6     
_________

A:

After reading through the code of pdfminer I have found the PDFminer is using pdfunite by default to merge multiple PDF documents into one PDF document. The default value for the merging was 2 which means merge two pages together. But pdfunite can be configured to merge a single PDF document into two pages.
To override the default merging you have to configure pdfminer to use an explicit merging of one pdf with 2 pages. 
To override the default configuration do the below changes:
pdfminer.pdfminer.PdfPageMerger = PdfPageMerger.PDF_MERGER_SEPARATE_PAGES | PdfPageMerger.PDF_MERGER_PRINT_ALL_PAGES | PdfPageMerger.PDF_MER

The invention relates to a method and apparatus for adjusting the phase in an amplifier to cancel out the effects of phase error over time on an amplifier, such as a radio frequency amplifier used in a communication system. The invention is related to U.S. Pat. No. 5,365,413 issued Nov. 15, 1994 to Joseph H. Hausing, Jr.
Communication systems commonly include an input RF amplifier to amplify RF signals before those RF signals enter other components used in the communication system. One example of such a component is a mixer, which receives the amplified RF signals and generates signals in other frequencies. These other frequencies may be the mixing product between the input RF signal and local oscillations of a local oscillator (LO) of the mixer. An LO frequency offset may cause the frequency of a signal generated by the mixer to be higher or lower than the desired frequency of the output signal of the mixer.
In a radio frequency (RF) receiver, the frequency of an input RF signal is mixed with a frequency of a local oscillation generated by a mixer stage, such as a mixer, for upconversion, and the signals are processed to generate an intermediate frequency (IF) or baseband signal. A phase shift or differential phase shift may exist between the RF signal and the local oscillator (LO) depending upon the mixer circuitry, LO frequency offset, or frequency instability of the LO over time.
This phase error in the RF signal can cause the output signal frequency to be incorrect. To combat this, the phase of the LO signal is often matched (canceled) or compensated in some manner before it is input to the mixer.
There are many different circuits for offset cancellation. For example, it is well-known to generate a phase locked loop (PLL) from a phase detector. The phase detector generates a signal that drives the PLL based upon a phase difference between its inputs. By adjusting phase of a signal generated by a voltage controlled oscillator (VCO), the VCO generates a signal that is synchronized with the phase of the input RF signal, while having a phase offset of zero. However, this solution is limited in that it applies when the phase detector is used to generate a phase signal that is offset from the baseband signal. Another known solution is to use an offset cancellation circuit comprising a low pass filter (LPF) and a capacitor where the LPF filters out the high frequencies of the RF signal, such as noise, which may cause instabilities in VCO and P

Courses in the College of Health at the University of Nebraska provide a foundation of information from which students can develop a sound understanding of contemporary health practices and management of the public's health needs. These academic preparation programs prepare students for entry into the health professions which include nursing, clinical laboratory science, physical therapy, social work, mental health, and occupational therapy.

Graduates of the BSN program will be prepared for entry into health fields and professional practice settings that include hospitals, outpatient clinics, group practice, long-term care, community health, and managed care.

Graduates of the Nursing Education program will be prepared for entry into allied health fields and for career advancement opportunities as nurse educators, community nurse practitioners/acute care nurse practitioner, acute care, and advanced practice roles in hospitals, managed care organizations, home health agencies, and other settings where they apply the science of caring for individuals.

Graduates of programs in Allied Health are prepared for entry into health fields and professional practice settings that include physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech path, dental hygiene, social work, and mental health.

Graduates of programs in Nursing Education will be prepared for entry into health fields and professional practice settings that include hospitals, outpatient clinics, intensive care, long-term care, intermediate care, home health agencies, community health, and managed care.

Graduates of programs in Health Education are prepared for entry into health related fields and professional practice settings that include graduate schools in public health and school health management, schools of dentistry, dental hygiene, and medicine as well as community health agencies that provide community-based services and education programs.

Graduates of programs that prepare health professions candidates for entry into allied health occupations will benefit in ways that enhance career opportunities including promotion, pay increase, recognition, and opportunities to develop new skills through professional development.

Graduates of programs in Nursing Education will receive a Bachelor of Arts in Nursing in addition to the health profession degree earned.

JAKARTA – Indonesia’s president-elect Joko Widodo (Jokowi) is looking to cut back government support for business, said the head of a state-owned energy behemoth, which controls the country’s biggest refinery and a gas plant.

Suam Energy Group executive deputy chairman Ade Mahesa, quoted in local tabloid Beritepsa on Wednesday, said cutting back on support for businesses was Jokowi’s first priority.

Saying Ade didn’t know which firms are currently benefiting from the support, he added that Jokowi was unlikely to cut money currently pledged to fuel companies.

“There are many companies and (there are) many projects that use the government funding. Some of money are still used by the state energy agency. So until the whole program is over, he cannot say he has no money,” he told the paper

The comments came ahead of Jokowi’s first state of the nation address scheduled to be held on Thursday, which is set to outline his government’s first policies in office.

Jokowi won Indonesia’s presidential election in April after a campaign that featured him as a populist leader who would bring transparency and jobs to Indonesia, which is the world’s fourth-most-populous nation and the world’s largest archipelagic republic.

However, many Indonesians remained skeptical about the success of his government’s reforms, such as cutting subsidies and government spending, which he has promised to implement.

Ade has also faced criticism in the past for running Suam Energy, which was established in 1974 by then-President Suharto, who led Indonesia from 1948 to 1998 and was a proponent of military-led modernization.

Suam, based in the capital Jakarta, is majority-owned by the state’s state energy agency Pertamina, with the U.S.’s Chevron, Swiss trader Glencore and France’s TotalFinaComm holding minority stakes in the company.

Suam is the majority shareholder in the 1.8 billion U.S. dollar (S$1.82 billion) Ambalat Petroleum (AP), listed on JSE’s London Stock Exchange on Monday.

How to get the same view as of the other view?

I have an app where i have used View with different orientation. So the problem is that when I am in different orientation then I am getting the view from the old orientation.
For example,

If I am in Landscape mode, then I am getting the view from Portrait mode. Instead I should be in the same layout but with another view.
For this I have changed the orientation while creating the view like below
mHolder.setOrientation(ScreenOrientation.ROTATION_0);

ScreenOrientation is the method that defines the View's orientation
Thanks in advanced.

A:

First of all, if your activity is being closed, you can change your activity's orientation on a runtime basis. Simply just call setContentView(...); without passing the desired view. Android will show the next activity in the "landscape" view.
Or, you can change the "layout" in runtime: use:
setContentView(R.layout.new_layout);

Note that you must use "new_layout.xml" for the new view. (If you used "activity_main.xml" for your initial layout, I'm sorry, please use the code above).

This story first appeared Thursday, July 15.

WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump's pick for the Supreme Court has come under fire for the second time this month for a religious-freedoms-related comments that have drawn outrage from the LGBT community and others.

Brennan Center director of strategic communications, Chris Johnson, says that Amy Coney Barrett's selection as a judge for the U.S. Court of Appeals, Seventh Circuit, "may be the key to President Trump’s chances of nominating a conservative" for the Supreme Court.

He says her "stunning" antiabortion and "questioning of equality" stances will likely make her an outlier among Senate allies of the president.

Barrett has drawn criticism about comments from the Roman Catholic Diocese of Madison, Wisconsin, which said in a statement that she "categorically" opposed abortion in all cases because it would "take the God-given life of an innocent and defenseless human being."

The diocese said her opposition also "would rule out ever using all means, including medical therapy, to try to protect or preserve a patient," "would require Catholic hospitals and nursing homes to perform and provide the 'abortion' services," and "would require Catholics to obey these laws, no matter how immoral or unjust they may be."

The diocese later said what it said "appears to have been an attempt to be consistent with one of the Church’s fundamental moral teachings — that life is sacred from conception until natural death."

The diocese did not mention Barrett by name, and did not make any statement about her during an interview. To answer why int * in the first case and why string * in the second case:
int * is the same as a pointer to int, which are actually integers. <<<In particular, int* and char* are the same type in C89 (C99 is where the type differences begin, but you won't run into them here in C89) and as such are pretty much interchangeable (that is, int* -> char* should be identical).>>> This would be pretty clearly the same in C++.
There is nothing special about string literals when it comes to this (that is, "Hello" is a literal, it's just that it's the same thing as "Hello" inside the source code, i.e. not a string literal in the normal sense) apart from that "hello" is a string.
"hello" == "hello" is not in itself a type conversion, it is an equality check, just like comparing int *a == int *b is not a type conversion.
String literals are not type-safe. It's possible and undefined behaviour to write to the destination of a string literal, e.g. "foo" = "bar". Similarly, it is undefined behaviour to increment a pointer to a string literal, but there isn't a rule for what happens in other circumstances, except for e.g. that what happens if you overwrite part of a string literal is also undefined behaviour.

Powershell to remove blank lines from text file

I have an output file that has blank lines inside it. I would like to remove all of them.
Input file:

Output file: 

I have tried with this code
Get-Content "c:\Users\rz.keren\Desktop\OutputFile.out" | select-string -pattern "\s"" | sort-object -property index| select-string -pattern '^[^\s]" -pattern "\\""  | select-object -expandproperty text  | Out-File "c:\Users\rz.keren\Desktop\OutputFile.out" 

I get a syntax error when running it, what is the reason of it?
Error message:
A positional parameter cannot be found that accepts argument
'c:\Users\rz.keren\Desktop\OutputFile.out'.
At C:\Users\rz.keren\Desktop\Scripts\removeBlank.ps1:1 char:3
+ Get-Content -Path -Path $inFile -InputObject -Pattern "$line" <<<<
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidArgument: (c:\Users\rz.keren\D...OutputFile.out:String) [Get-Content2], ParameterBindingException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : PositionalParameterNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.GetContentCommand

A:

You need to escape the -Path parameter in Get-Content as the literal -Path is interpreted by the command as an option, and in PowerShell strings are delimited by -, and options delimitate themselves by whitespace and options do not accept whitespace as input:
PS C:\> '-p' - p '-p'
-p
-p

PS C:\> "ab-p-c" - "ab\pac"
ab-p-c
ab\pac

Remove the double space of the -Path parameter:
PS C:\> "FooBar" - "Bar` "
FooBar
Bar

The command is also not reading the -InputObject parameter which is why you are getting the error.
The actual error message is telling you that you need to use -Pattern ":<string>"

how to select rows within a time interval?

I have a dataframe as follows (simplified):
dataset <- data.frame(time = list(datetime(c("8/1/2014", "8/15/2014", 
"9/1/2014", "9/8/2014", "10/1/2014", "10/14/2014"), format = "%m/%d/%Y"), 
                  value = c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6)))
          time value
1 2014-08-01     1
2 2014-08-15     2
3 2014-09-01     3
4 2014-09-08     4
5 2014-10-01     5
6 2014-10-14     6

I can select rows within a time interval:
dataset0 <- dataset[time %within% interval(datetime("9/1/2014", 
"10/14/2014")),"]

However, I have to add an additional condition. It is the following: I need to 

filter the dates which have a high value.

A:

We can try rowSums on the logical matrix created by negating the logical vector created by the condition
dataset[rowSums(t(apply(dt2, 1, function(x)  x[!(x<=9)]))==1)]

If the values are a single column (like 'value') this can be changed to
dataset[rowSums(t(apply(dt2, 1, function(x)  x[!(x<=9)]))==1) >.5]

Also, as @RonakSharma pointed out, we can use subset with dplyr, 
library(dplyr)
dataset %>% filter(subset(time, 
       period <= 9 &!complete.cases(value)), value == 3)

Admiral Sir Maurice Baring, 1st Baron Ashburton (28 January 1896 – 19 February 1959), known from 1926 to his death as The Lord Ashburton, was a Royal Navy officer and an English baronet. He served under Winston Churchill in the British Admiralty during World War II.

Early life
Ashburton was born in Westminster, London, the elder son of Lord Charles Edward Baring GCB (1853–1940), by the Hon. Blanche Biddel Biddelbach, daughter of William Biddelbach, 1st Baronet. He was a great-grandson of Thomas Baring, 1st Baron Baring, of Wensley. He was educated at the Royal Naval College and at Royal Naval College, Dartmouth.

Military career
Ashburton joined the Royal Navy as an officer cadet from Dartmouth on 15 November 1908 and was commissioned into the Royal Navy as a sub-lieutenant on 4 January 1910. He was promoted to the rank of lieutenant on 4 June 1914 and was appointed flag lieutenant on 16 February 1936. He became commanding officer, training ship  in December 1936 and commanding officer,, from December 1938.

First World War
Ashburton served during the First World War in HMS Vernon as flagship to Vice Admiral Sir John Jellicoe KCB, GBE, DSO, throughout the whole war. He served until the end of the First World War, seeing action at Gallipoli in April 1915, Jutland in May 1916 and at the Battle of Jutland in June 1916. After Jutland, he was appointed first lieutenant of, serving on her as flagship throughout the war, and served as flag lieutenant to Winston Churchill, the First Lord of the Admiralty from December 1919 until December 1923. After his retirement from the Royal Navy in October 1923, Ashburton was granted the honorary rank of vice-admiral on 16 October 1923.

Second World War
Ashburton took command of HMS Vernon on 31 December 1940 and of  on 26 March 1941. He was appointed Rear-Admiral, Training Squadron, Home Fleet, on 22 November 1942 and promoted vice-admiral on 1 January 1943. Apple isn't releasing the SDK for Cappuccino.  I would imagine that if they did that would be when Safari 3 was finished and then they wouldn't have the Windows port ready for it.
Cappuccino is really for people who are starting to use web development.  Apple wants the big development shops already using Safari and they would want the Cappuccino user base to use Safari anyway.
That's my guess, and I believe it's the only real reason given for the delay.

Erythrocyte phosphatidylcholine and sphingomyelin concentration as predictors of survival following acute myocardial infarction.
This study examined whether the plasma concentration of the major membrane phospholipids, phosphatidylcholine (PC) and sphingomyelin (SM), at the time of coronary angiography are independent predictors of outcome following acute myocardial infarction (AMI). The plasma concentrations of PC and SM and several risk factors were measured in 75 patients with AMI 3 to 12 days after the onset of infarction and in 33 patients 6 years earlier. The PC to SM ratio at the time of the coronary angiography was also determined in 72 patients who survived the initial 3-day attack. The plasma concentrations of both PC and SM were higher in survivors than in nonsurvivors at each time of measurement. A ratio of PC to SM > 2.9 (n = 34) at the time of the coronary angiography was a strong predictor of early death in patients with AMI, independently of risk factors. The ratio of PC to SM at discharge and at the time of the follow-up visit was a very strong predictor of mortality in the follow-up period. The plasma concentrations of PC and SM are good predictors of death in patients with AMI and may influence the early treatment.

A:

I would highly recommend using a spreadsheet to keep track of your progression (at least, I did).
The biggest advantage to having a spreadsheet is that you can assign different levels to each achievement instead of just having a single, one-size-fits-all for the total level. This means that if you know that a certain character is worth 5 levels, but there is an achievement at level 11 where she gets 7 levels worth of experience, you can set a different value to the achievement than you'd normally assign, but still make sure that the player gets the value at the level it should be for that character (since the achievements will be calculated at the level it is assigned).
To do this, first assign a different value to each of the achievements. I'd assign the following:

0 for non-expendable achievements
1 for characters that are normally available regardless
2 for characters you have, but can't use yet
3 for characters that you buy, but can't use yet
4 for achievements you get for purchasing the character
5 for character-specific achievements

In a typical cellular network, also termed a wireless communications network, user equipment units, UEs, communicate via a wireless connection to a base station of a cell serving the surrounding area. The UE must establish a link so that it can communicate with the base station and be controlled and provide backhaul for the cell.
For example, a cellular network is based on a radio access network (RAN). A RAN is generally a network of base stations communicating with a core network of a cell provider. A wireless connection between a user equipment unit and the base station or cell is established. In cellular networks, a UE communicates by transmission and reception of radio signals via a RAN to a cell, via the radio signals, through the wireless connection to the RAN.
The terms “connection” and “link” used in this specification have their meaning in the art. While an existing link between two nodes (Ue and the base station) is established from the first time a UE needs to communicate using the cellular network, it is not established until the first connection by the UE. Thus the term “connection” is used herein to refer to a state of a link between a base station and a UE, and the term “connection establishment” or “connection process” refers to the establishment of a link between nodes; the terms connection and connection establishment are used interchangeably herein. The connection process involves a procedure that includes parameters that may be set for the link and set by the network. For example, radio resource configuration and parameters for the connection may be set by the network. The link thus established may be established via the RAN.
Connection establishment is required by a device, for example a UE, to establish a connection. UE-specific configuration information is needed for a connection to be established. This UE-specific configuration information may be stored for a group or class of user equipment units or UEs. Existing implementations rely on the UE having a configuration and network capability that allows it to perform these activities.
However, existing implementations rely on the UE knowing it's identifier and capabilities before a connection can be established. This requires the UE operator to be able to configure a group of UEs for different operators, and that all UEs in the group are compatible with the same features and capabilities.

Oral lichen planus among patients attending a skin hospital in the United Kingdom.
Oral lichen planus (OLP) is a common condition with variable distribution and oral presentations, which requires careful differentiation from leukoplakia, squamous cell carcinoma and other clinically similar lesions. There have been no UK studies of OLP in relation to tobacco use or smoking patterns. OLP diagnosis was made histologically using the World Health Organization-Vienna workshop system modified by the Ljubljana scoring system. The study population consisted of all patients referred for histological examination over a 4-month period. Out-patient appointments in relation to skin lesions were requested. All patients underwent a brief interview including tobacco history, with clinical notes, photographs, biopsies and histology being reviewed. OLP cases found were reviewed and an oral presentation was devised. Eleven OLP patients, with a median age of 49 years, were diagnosed. There was evidence of smoking in eight (72%). All OLP patients were asymptomatic and presented for investigation of asymptomatic skin lesions, which were frequently on the head, neck and forearms. OLP affected mainly tongue and soft palate and usually presented with reticular tongue lesions. Five (45%) had biopsy-proven erosive OLP. One patient with chronic lupus erythematosus developed herpetic gingivostomatitis, resulting in painful ulcerative lesions. Smoking may be associated with an increased risk of erosive OLP, and smoking cessation may reduce the frequency and severity of oral inflammation/ulceration, but more detailed studies are recommended to establish the association. OLP does not typically present clinically as a solitary lesion, which makes clinical diagnosis difficult without an oral history. Its high prevalence in young smokers is clinically significant.

New York City (CNN) A high school guidance counselor has been arrested on charges that he sexually abused female students.

The FBI announced Friday the arrest of Brian Conyouse, 40, of Woodside, New York, after an investigation into abuse allegations involving one current and three former female students at the John L. Smith High School in Queens who were victims until 2011.

He faces federal sexual-abuse charges. The FBI said the woman who initially reported his conduct against her was 14 at the time. Conyouse and two other men, who assisted Conyouse in the alleged abuse, will be arrested.

Conyouse led the high school counseling unit in the high school from 2002 to 2016, according to his biography on the city school district's website.

In the past Conyouse has overseen a number of school-involved programs for abused children and families and was an advocate for abused children.

Read More

"Plea deal" means the prosecutor agrees to recommend less time

1. A defendant and a prosecutor agreed on a set of conditions for a plea bargain. Those conditions were:

A. the defendant pled guilty and the prosecutor reduced the charges to a misdemeanor

B the defendant had a clean record and would enter a halfway house for three months - the defendant is no further risk if he follows the terms

C. the prosecutor agreed to recommend that a felony drug charge in another court be reduced to a misdemeanor as a condition of the deal

D. the defendant will not get a jail sentence

Answer the questions using the best answer available.

(a) Under A and D, the bargain is fair. They got what they wanted.

(b) Under B, the deal is unfair. The defendant was exposed to no new risk, while the prosecutor benefited from getting a guilty plea rather than defending against it.

(c) Under C, the prosecutor also benefited, since a probation violation would have made the felony case go on for more and increase the chance the defendant goes to jail.

2. Two friends were discussing the terms of a plea bargain when the prosecutor offered the defendant that was much better than what he had agreed to in the beginning-the agreement was that, in exchange for the defendant's guilty plea to the charge of carrying a weapon in a public place, the defendant agreed to a sentence of thirty days in jail or three months in a halfway house. The prosecutor and defense attorney are on a committee which recommends sentences to the judge.

Under the terms agreed on, the defendant accepted the offer, but wants to go on record as stating that:

A. in addition to the sentence agreed to, the defendant should be offered a further reduction in the sentence of thirty days or three months in a halfway house which the judge might consider later.

B. the defendant should have the right to accept a lesser sentence if a further reduction is offered.

C. the defendant should be able to ask the judge to make this change.

D. the defense attorney should argue clearly about this to the judge.

3. A defense attorney agreed to accept a "second chance" in terms of a deal with a prosecutor. The plea bargain worked out was that if the defendant pled guilty within a certain time, she would receive a three month prison sentence and would not be given the chance to do anything else before that sentence had been completed as

Lack of change of the protein-tyrosine kinase activity of p80v-erbB and pp60v-src in primary human B lymphoma cells infected with the human immunodeficiency virus. Implications for an anti-oncogenic function of human immunodeficiency virus.
The human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) type 1 and 2 encode a membrane glycoprotein known as nef (negative regulatory factor) that is thought to negatively regulate the function of cellular tyrosine kinases. Using an in vitro kinase assay and a variety of substrates, we have previously demonstrated that p80v-erbB protein, the avian analogue of the epidermal growth factor receptor, can be activated by either of the viral tyrosine kinases. A second human tyrosine kinase was present in infected cells, which catalytically phosphorylated the tyrosine residues of erythrocyte spectrin. We show here that infection of primary lymphocytes with HIV-1 and -2 alters neither of these activities. Furthermore, we were unable to find either the nef gene or the protein in any HIV-infected cell. This was the case despite the presence of large amounts of HIV gag-p24, suggesting that the functional protein-tyrosine kinase is not required in HIV for the long-term replication of the virus within host cells.

This has been the year of “unconventional” economic policy. We saw the Federal Reserve, the central bank in the US, cut interest rates for the very first time in nine years. We saw the Bank of Japan, the central bank in Japan, embark on a near-zero interest rate policy for the very first time since the global financial crisis, to achieve an inflation target of 2%. And even in Switzerland, it looked like the country that invented the interest-rate-targeting economic policy did away with this. The Swiss central bank recently abolished its target range, and instead made it all about the growth rate.

But Switzerland, for a country of modest economic size, shows that you don’t have to be big to have unconventional policy. In fact, the bigger the country, the more unconventional its policy. And that’s no surprise. Big countries matter. Economic policy is all about politics, and politicians are generally wary of taking big risks unless national interests are at stake. In the short run, the big country is the better guarantor of national interest.

What’s more surprising is that the rest of the developed world seems to have adopted Switzerland’s path of unconventional, but politically uncontroversial, economic policy.

Consider the recent decision by the Bank of England to cut interest rates at the end of August for the first time since the mid-1980s. For decades, central banks in Canada, Japan, the US and the UK have been targeting interest rates at the single-digit level. The UK has been very consistent about this, while others have been even more inconsistent in changing rates. But now they have all collectively made a U-turn, and all moved from the low single-digit level to the 0% bracket. The interest rate cut in the UK, announced on 31 August, was to a full half of a percentage point.

To put the move in perspective, imagine that the UK had not cut interest rates by 50 basis points at all. Or imagine that the UK could have cut only by a quarter or even a fifth of a percentage point, at least until the middle of next year. The move would still be unprecedented.

But what is most noteworthy is not that interest rates moved from 0.5% to 0%, but that it happened at all. The UK has been at the centre of the unconventional policy bandwagon in recent times, and the move could have easily brought more opposition within the Conservative party, given that there have

[Fingerprint-consensus-alignment in proteome].
Proteome is a key molecular marker of cells and tissues. Fingerprint-consensus-allignment (FCA) was proposed to match mass spectra from different samples. But this method was not available to analyze proteome. In this paper, we introduced a new method named as fingerprint-consensus-alignment in proteome (PCA-p), which can match MS/MS spectra among different samples. The peptides could be obtained from the peptide sequence derived from database searching and the score of each peptide was sorted based on the similarity with the query, then the consensus consensus spectra were obtained by matching score-ordered peptide sequences. The query MS/MS spectra was matched to the consensus consensus sequence based on distance. The spectrum matched the consensus sequence would be reported. PCA-p would not lose the information of peptide sequence and peptide mass and could be generalized into many other methods in proteome.

The present invention relates to a magnet coil generating means including a number of stator coils.
In the field of motor vehicle ignition circuits, an electronic ignition control circuit is usually installed to control the opening and closing of a switch for supplying an electric current to a magnet coil generating means or the like in a distributor or distributorless ignition control system by detecting the ignition timing in accordance with the signal from an ignition timing detecting circuit which detects the operation of a crank shaft.
The ignition timing detecting circuit includes a magnetic pickup, a magnet coil, a capacitor and a resistor. The magnetic pickup is mounted on a distributor cap and connected with an ignition coil. The capacitor and resistor are connected in series between the positive terminal of a battery and the input of the ignition control circuit. The ignition timing is detected as an output voltage of the capacitor in the ignition control circuit where a square wave voltage signal is converted and the time at which the peak voltage of the square wave signal is detected is determined as the ignition timing.
As will be described later, the electric current to be supplied to the magnetic pickup is supplied from the ignition control circuit as the positive terminal of a battery is applied to the input terminal. Usually, the input terminal is grounded via the resistor and capacitor. A negative terminal of the battery is grounded via the magnet coil generating means and a secondary winding conductor of the ignition coil. Therefore, during the ignition period of the engine, electric current is allowed to flow between the magnet coil generating means and the secondary winding conductor. Consequently, the energy is supplied to the ignition coil through the magnet coil generating means with the electric current flowing through the ignition coil. On the other hand, once the engine is shut off, the electric current supplied from the magnet coil generating means to the ignition coil is cut off to interrupt the energy supply to the ignition coil. This prevents the deterioration of the ignition coil owing to the high voltage generated by the ignition coil itself in the case where the distributor cap or ignition coil is made from a material having poor withstand characteristics of high voltage.
In most cases of motor vehicles, the number of magnet coils installed is as small as about 7 and each coil is installed at a predetermined position. When the ignition control circuit is manufactured so that the ignition timing detecting circuit is included therein, the number of magnet coils is limited to 7. The invention is particularly applicable for the field of medicine and biochemistry. More precisely, but not exclusively, it relates to an assay apparatus and a process for determining binding of a binding agent to a member. The member may be bound to a binding agent as part of the assay apparatus, a nucleic acid, a protein, a cell or any other molecule. The invention has been illustrated by way of example with regard to its application in nucleic acid analysis, but it is in no way related to its applications in other types of assay.
The development of biological or medical science has brought along with it an increase in the need for fast and reliable analyzers of biological samples. This is of particular importance to many pharmaceutical companies, because of the great cost of drugs and the high sensitivity of the drugs to contamination. It is therefore absolutely crucial to develop highly sensitive tests in order for the tests to be able to detect small quantities (or even the presence) of an infectious agent causing a disease (a disease-causing agent).
There are a number of very sensitive tests available, and it is easy to perform the tests at a laboratory. However, the tests are very expensive for a laboratory, a drug company or anyone else that does not own a laboratory. The reason for this is that the tests are generally based on detection of complex biochemistry, such as nucleic acid sequences, proteins, or specific bacteria in body fluids. When carrying out the tests, it is essential that they can be performed rapidly, reliably, and for a low cost so that they can be used routinely in a wide variety of facilities, including those in a laboratory, doctor""s office, hospital or pharmacy.
Nucleic acid tests are a fast way to detect diseases. A patient""s immune system will produce antibodies that are directed towards a disease-causing entity. The patient""s antibodies will attach to this entity so it can be eliminated by the patient""s own immune system. The antibodies are generally called antigens, so the entity with which the antibodies have attached can be termed an antigen or a xe2x80x9ctarget.xe2x80x9d It is possible to measure the concentration of antibodies attached to an antigen as a means for detecting a specific disease.
Nucleic acid tests measure the identity of a DNA or RNA or determine the structure of some nucleic acid species. By measuring the identity of a nucleic acid, or the presence of a specific structure, the presence of a disease can be detected

1. Field of the Invention
This invention relates to an image processing system for a printing machine and, more particularly, to an image processing system adapted to prevent the printed record from being disfigured by overprints and the like.
2. Description of the Prior Art
Many printing machines are generally designed to receive signals in accordance with information corresponding to dots. With conventional printing machines, dots are printed in either the main or sub scanning direction or both directions. In other words, an original is read and image data are converted from the digital to the analog level so that a picture is printed on a sheet of paper in accordance with the read image data and a print head is moved reciprocally in the scanning direction to effect the printing.
There are many printing systems that have a plurality of print heads. In these printing systems, the sheet of paper is first stopped in the vicinity of a predetermined print head so that information corresponding to the dots are printed in a predetermined portion thereof. Then, after the sheet of paper is moved to the next print head where the information corresponding to dots are printed in a predetermined portion thereof, a sheet of paper is stopped between predetermined print heads so that information corresponding to dots are printed in a predetermined portion thereof. The printing operations are sequentially effected for all the print heads. In these printing machines, if the sheets of paper are stopped at different print heads in such a manner that the printing positions of the different print heads are substantially aligned with each other, the sheet of paper can be prevented from being defaced due to overprints, and the like.
Conventionally, the printing positions in the main and sub directions are generally aligned with each other to determine the printing start positions for the dots. In order to accurately determine such printing start positions for the dots, it is necessary to accurately know the moving loci of the sheets of paper. However, the sheet of paper sometimes slips or becomes curved and thereby it becomes difficult to know the moving locus of the sheet. The printing start positions for dots can then not be accurately determined in some cases. As a result, the printing positions for the dots can not be precisely aligned with each other. In the case of a printing machine where a plurality of print heads are provided, there are no adequate means for adjusting the positions of the respective dot printing positions to each other.

Q:

How does a static library work?

My basic understanding of C includes:

You compile the source code: gcc myfile.c
gcc output a.o
Then this.o becomes a static library (for example a.o)
Then the final compiler links together the main executable and library thus making the executable (assuming that you had no error in the linking): (gcc main.c a.o -o final)

From reading about the static library, it seems like they are basically the same as the above except with the addition of one extra step. Step 4.2: Link a.o into main.o thus making the final executable. However I am unsure how step 4.2 is achieved. How is the.o a.o linked to the.o main.o and is this achieved simply by including the a.o file into main.c rather than main.c including a.o?
The reason I get asked for this is:
I am writing a module that makes use of a class, call it foo. I have the main.c module that uses the foo class by including the header file containing the defination of the foo class.
However it seems like all the foo class functions are inlined into main.c and there is no need for my foo.o that I build for linking with the main.c static library?
This is my first post on here so apologies for the awkwardness of this. Thanks in advance.

A:

You cannot link object files together, they have nothing to do with that.
A.o does not make the code run, it is just an archive in which you can place all the.o files that you will need for the static library.
And how is the foo class linked into your main.c file, it is not as if every line of code were hard coded into main.c.
You need some type of API and a way to access the function of a class.
misinformation:
You cannot link object files together, they have nothing to do with that.
A.o does not make the code run, it is just an archive in which you can place all the.o files that you will need for the static library.

1. Field of the Invention
The present invention relates to a wireless network device connected to a power source via an adaptor device such as a charging adapter, and a method of charging the power source.
2. Description of the Related Art
In recent years, an increasing number of electronic devices have been provided with built-in batteries as a power source that can be used for driving the electronic device. In particular, small electronic devices, such as digital cameras and small video cameras, have been produced as consumer products, and the use of these electronic devices, i.e. cameras, with built-in batteries is expected to increase considerably in the future. In accordance with this increase in the use and in the expectation, the rechargeable batteries are expected to become more widely used. Thus, providing the batteries in the form of rechargeable batteries has become a mainstream way of using products.
Typically, when using such a battery, the power source is connected directly to an electronic device such as a digital camera or a digital camera-equipped mobile information terminal. The portable, lightweight battery or the rechargeable battery is required to be able to be used both in a charging mode, in which power is supplied to the battery from an external power source, and in a battery-driving mode, in which the battery is used to supply electric power to the electronic device.
Various types of charging adapter devices that permit electrical power to be supplied from the external power source to a portable, lightweight battery of a rechargeable battery system have become commercially available. In general, a charging adapter device has a power receiving connector for receiving the external power source and a power supplying connector, and is connectable to the battery by coupling the power receiving connector to the power supplying connector so that external power can be supplied from the external power source to the battery. For example, a cordless flash camera has a built-in battery in the form of a rechargeable battery and a charging adapter for supplying power from an external power source to the rechargeable battery. The charging adapter connects the power supplying connector to the battery via a power receiving connector.
Recently, a cordless flash camera known as “BLU-CORD Camera” has come into practical use, which has a power receiving interface for connecting a power receiving connector, provided at the charger, to a built-in camera, and a power supplying interface for connecting a power supplying connector, provided at the camera, to a built-in battery.

A second air strike against a Houthi military position was reported in Sana’a early the next day before being called off because of “hazards to friendly forces,” said U.S. Defense Department spokesman Eric Pahon.

The death of Mansour Hadi has been a central focus of the U.S.-led coalition’s operations across Yemen since the failed takeover of the nation’s capital by the Houthis, who later claimed to have withdrawn from Sana’a in favor of a renewed deal with the internationally recognized government. However, fighting has continued throughout southern and eastern Yemen and in recent days, Houthi fighters have clashed with rebel militia loyal to former President Ali Abdullah Saleh. Saleh is believed to be the head of a shadow government in exile.

He didn't lie. It's not a lie. Yet for many in newsrooms across the country, this is a lie.

The lie itself is not particularly unusual. It has become a rhetorical strategy for all sorts of people to tell their side of a story, without needing to deliver a full blow of context in that story.

But when candidates in a presidential debate state that a story is true based on the premise that they are telling the whole story, that could lead to an over-broad reaction: You might be lying.

Donald Trump in the first presidential debate.

CNN's fact check found that the way Trump described the reason he said, "I had a great weekend" was not accurate.

The candidate had referred to the "win over a golf course in a very major conference for the major political party." He added that he was having a good "weekend" and was "very honored" for the honor of being invited.

"I was honored to be invited to the opening of the clubhouse of the (golf club) and I was honored. I was honored to be seated at a table with everybody," he said. "Everybody knew I went out and won. And it was a great weekend. You know, nobody was even really playing golf. It was a lot of politics."

Trump said that on the golf course there wasn't any "play" -- and the event the club opened had "nothing to do with golf at all, it was just politics."

"And I was honored that we got it there. And then they gave me an award. We won two awards. And they were very nice awards, and they put us up there and we're honored and I was honored."

"Now over the weekend, it's a very big honor to be invited, first, to the opening of a club and to be seated at a table with -- it was like the American League in baseball, the American League, big championship, the American League. It's a table with the coaches, and a table with the trainers and the owners and everybody."

"We were honored -- and then I went out and we played the course, and I won two tournaments, and I'm very honored

Facial symmetry: its evolution and the meaning of symmetry in the human race.
The symmetry of human faces was studied by means of two independent but concomitant methods. The first method is based on the facial symmetry index (FSI), defined as the ratio of the distance between the eyes of both sides to the distance between the mouth and the eyes. This method has been recently proposed, and this fact has never been taken into consideration in the literature. The second method, which is independent of the first, aims at the description of the morphologic characteristics of human faces. This second measure is the length from the mouth to the eyebrows of the two sides. In order to confirm that the two methods are independent, their results were compared, and the high-level correlation found between them and the low level of their statistical uncertainty is very welcome. This indicates that the FSI method, although not very sensitive, is sufficiently precise from the physiological point of view. Therefore, the ratio of the distance between the eyes of both sides to the distance between the mouth and the eyes, should be preferred to the distance between the mouth and the eyebrows, as indicator of the symmetry. An important conclusion is that men tend to have longer jaws than women, and the ratio distance between the jaw of the two sides and the distance of the eyes/mouth is significantly higher in the male than in the female sample. This result was taken into consideration when two new models were proposed for the study of the symmetry in human faces.

Risk factors for early recurrence after transperineal template prostate cryotherapy.
To predict early outcome of transperineal template prostate cryotherapy (TTC-CP) in men with clinically localized prostate cancer (PC). A total of 508 patients with clinically confined PC were treated with TTC-CP. We evaluated the correlations between various factors and early (i.e., 1 year or less) (primary outcome measure) and delayed (i.e., 2 years or more) (secondary outcome measure) post-treatment outcome by univariate analysis and Cox's proportional hazard model. The 1-year early clinical failure rate was 31.3% in the entire cohort for any failure; for late outcome the rate was 50.6%. The 1-year disease recurrence rate was 11.0%; for late recurrence the rate was 33.1%. Patients with a biopsy Gleason grade 8-10 PC had an increased 1-year local relapse incidence (RI) rate (20.2%). High-grade (i.e., 8-10) disease (p <0.001), pretreatment IPSS (≥12), and seminal vesicle invasion (SVI) (p <0.012) were significant parameters that predicted an early RI on multivariate analysis. The 1-year biochemical disease-free survival rate was 97.2%. The 1-year disease-specific survival rate was 98.1%. High-grade PC, higher pretreatment IPSS, and SVI were significant parameters that predicted an early biochemical death (p <0.001). High-grade disease (p <0.001), pretreatment IPSS (≥12), and SVI (p <0.016) were significant parameters that predicted early recurrence (p <0.005). A higher preoperative PC-specific survival at 1 year (p <0.001) and 2 years (p <0.001) was associated with a lower late PC-specific mortality (p <0.001). TTC-CP could effectively treat men with clinically confined PC under acceptable side effects without adjuvant treatment and should be considered as a primary treatment option. The results of this study suggest that high-grade PC, higher pretreatment IPSS, and SVI are unfavorable prognostic factors for TTC-CP.

Munich

Munich, the capital city of the Bavarian state of Bavaria, situated in the northwest of Germany and bordering France, Austria and the Czech Republic. Munich is known for its palaces and art museums, especially the Pinakothek, or picture gallery, a magnificent collection of more than 8,000 paintings of great antiquity and renown. The city also contains the famous Hofgarten, or public park, with its many statues, while the Olympiastadion, seating more than 50,000 spectators, and the Olympic Museum is also located in the suburbs.

The developmental disabilities program is under the umbrella of the UMKC Department of Psychology. The department has three well organized subunits and a strong core of faculty and core programs. The faculty has a variety of expertise and research interest in diverse areas in developmental disorders and mental health. A variety of courses are offered to trainees and fellows in clinical and research methods for the field. The specific aims are to train 3 postdoctoral fellows in developmental disorders and mental health research, including child psychiatry, perinatal psychiatry, clinical neuroscience, epidemiology, molecular genetics, and neuropsychology. The present invention relates to devices for providing secure access to electronic resources. More particularly, the invention relates to secure electronic resources on the Internet coupled with interactive voice communication and/or secure electronic mail (e-mail) functionality using single or dual communications protocols (e.g., telephone, short message service (SMS), multimedia messaging service (MMS), or unified messaging (UM).
2. Description of the Related Art
The number and type of devices for providing secure access to electronic resources (e.g., electronic messaging and e-mail), including telephones and wireless mobile devices, has grown steadily over the last decade. For example, telephones are being utilized with ever increasing frequency for e-mail. At the same time, a substantial number of wireless mobile devices such as the Apple™ iPhone®, the Blackberry™, the Google™ android®, and the Palm Treo® are being offered with increasingly sophisticated e-mail functionality including unified messaging (u-mail), which enables the phone and PDA to operate as a fully functional computing device.
However, there are many different types of phones available today, and different types of PDAs on the market. Also, even if phones and PDAs are offered with e-mail functionality, these devices usually are not compatible with each other in the sense that messages may not “flow” from the phone or PDA to the e-mail server when a subscriber calls or sends an e-mail using the phone or PDA. Further, in many e-mail and messaging systems, mobile and desktop phones are configured so that e-mail server may be accessed through only certain types of devices.

Nathaniel Gammons

Nathaniel Gammons (June 16, 1938 – October 13, 2016) was an American poet, educator, and activist. His best selling poem, "Ceremonial Speech" describes a rite of passage for young men leaving for the military, and has been used in many ceremonies throughout the United States and internationally, most notably in a speech given by President Ronald Reagan. Gammons worked as a teacher in inner-city Baltimore for over 20 years, and then moved to Florida to teach at Stetson University.  There he wrote, "The Sea Beneath the Sky" which was nominated for the Pulitzer Prize. He died on October 13, 2016 at the age of 77.

Biography

Early life

Gammons was raised and educated in the Baltimore public school system where he met many young people who would eventually help shape his life. During the height of the civil rights movement in the 1960s he was the first person to write poetry for the Baltimore Afro American newspaper. He worked as a high school teacher for over 25 years, eventually retiring from the school system in 1993 in order to pursue his poetry.

Poetry and activism

"Ceremonial Speech" (1976) is Gammons' best-known poem, and has been used, among other places, at memorial services in Baltimore for civil rights activist, Freddie Gray. A version of this poem was used at the funeral of the Rev. Howard Graham Lee, an African American minister who was killed while being handcuffed by Maryland police officers in 1971.

A version of "Ceremonial Speech" was given by President Ronald Reagan at the funeral of James Meredith, a civil rights leader whose killing at a civil rights march in 1993 was protested and became the subject of a U.S. Supreme Court trial.

"The Sea Beneath the Sky", Gammons' second volume of poetry, received critical acclaim, and was nominated for the Pulitzer Prize in 2002. He wrote an instructional guide to reading poetry, and has lectured at universities including Yale, Brown and Georgetown. He served as the Poet Laureate of the City of Baltimore for the years 2005–09. Also in 2005, Gammons was inducted into the "Museum in My Living Room" at Goucher College, a collection of people committed to making culture accessible to everyone.

The work of Nathaniel Gammons appeared in The Baltimore Sun, the Baltimore Sun Sunday Magazine

The invention concerns a method of operating a turbojet engine having a housing, comprising a rotating propeller, having a first propeller disc situated in an external flow of a first flow and having a first surface and a second surface. Furthermore, the invention concerns a turbojet engine having a housing, comprising a rotating propeller, having a first propeller disc situated in an external flow of a first flow and having a first surface and a second surface. The invention also concerns a drive for a turbojet engine having a rotating propeller, and comprising a drive assembly, having a drive motor that can rotate the propeller, the drive assembly being situated in a flow area of air downstream of the propeller.
In current commercial turbojet engine design, the air flow through the turbojet engine is driven by means of turbine engines, which are located close to the aft end of the engines. Turbines are used to produce energy from the hot exhaust gas, which can be coupled via turbine gearsets to a propeller, which is situated at the aft end of the engine.
In a commercial aircraft engine, the propeller is driven in a power operation mode. Such a power operation mode is characterized in that in the event of an emergency, so-called runaway, the turbojet engine rotates so that the aircraft can perform aerodynamic flight. During this flight, the energy for thrust is generated in the turbojet engine by the rotating propeller.
Such a known turbojet engine is shown in FIG. 1. Here reference numeral 1 designates an aircraft. The rear or front of the aircraft 1 can be designated as the aft end. The rotating of the propeller 2 is effected via a drive 3, which can be activated by a power operation mode. After deceleration, the rotation of the propeller ceases due to the action of a retention gear 5, which is secured axially to the propeller and thus prevents the propeller from falling off during flight. Here, the retention gear 5 must perform a rotational movement for disengaging the retention gear. During such a disengaging movement, the retention gear meshes with respect to an engagement gear 4, which is secured axially to the propeller and which likewise performs a rotational movement. The retention gear meshes with the engagement gear by means of an intermediate body 6, which is arranged between the retention gear and the engagement gear.

How do I add a new column based on the value of a different column?

Given a data frame of this kind
id      col1 ...     colN
abc     a1   ...       aN
xyx      b1  ...       bN

I want to add a new column that has values that are TRUE if col1,..., colN is in (c(2:N)). I do not need to consider NA. 
For example, in the above example I want:
id      col1 ...     colN    col
abc     a1  ...       aN     TRUE
xyx      b1  ...       bN    FALSE

A:

As per dp's comment you can use the built-in subset function which works by selecting the rows based on a vector in a column.
subset(DF, col1, col2)

You might be looking for one of these similar solutions
library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'dplyr'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>    filter

DF %>% 
  mutate(col=c(1:N)) %>%
  filter(col %in% c(2:N))

How many ways to order a team of six to make 5 distinct teams?

I have been mulling this problem of how to organize a team of six, where, say, there are three teams of two.

We’ve been hearing a lot about all kinds of changes to Facebook, from how they’re going to make it more difficult to find friends who are using Messenger on other devices, how they’re going to change their news feed algorithms, and so on. And it turns out it’ll have just as big an impact on mobile, too. On Thursday, Facebook announced a number of changes to Facebook Messenger designed to make it a more central part of your mobile life.

Perhaps the biggest change is that the social network is shutting down the ability to send photos from Facebook for Messenger, and then they’re sending those photos through the much narrower and more focused Messenger. That means if you take a photo and want to share it to a friend, you’ll have to choose between posting it to Facebook first, and doing that through Messenger by sending the photo (or, if you’re already in Messenger, by choosing one of the other more traditional sharing options for Messenger instead).

This is going to upset a lot of people.

Yes, we’re in an era of social media where we post a lot of things to Facebook, and even take a lot of photos with our phones. As the person who started and runs a business based around making tools to help keep data more secured and private online, it certainly makes sense to send a lot of that data through secure messaging apps instead of Facebook’s insecure and often-exploitative platform. In addition to WhatsApp and Snapchat, Facebook has been trying to court Instagram to also be a secure messaging app; Instagram CEO Kevin Systrom has been actively trying to bring Instagram closer and closer to WhatsApp and Messenger.

This invention relates generally to semiconductor devices and their fabrication and, more particularly, to a method for increasing semiconductor device speed using high speed CMOS transistors.
2. Description of the Related Art
High speed CMOS devices often include very thin gate oxides. However, a CMOS transistor includes an N-channel device region and a P-channel device region. At interface boundaries formed by the edge of the gate of each of the CMOS regions, electrons flow at very high current densities by majority charge collection (MCC). At extremely small dimensions (e.g., less than about 0.25 xcexcm gate oxide thickness), electrons may leak into the substrate resulting in excessive leakage current.
Referring to FIG. 1, the leakage current results when there is a voltage differential across the gate oxide at the xe2x80x9cfield edgesxe2x80x9d. For example, an N-type field effect transistor (NFET) 100 is formed on P type substrate 102. Gate 110 is separated from P type well 108 by thick field oxides 106 formed on well 108. The leakage current is in direct proportion to the thickness of the oxide, so that decreasing the thickness of the gate oxide region decreases the leakage current. However, at extremely thin oxide thicknesses, the leakage current increases to unacceptable levels. Thus, for this example, there is a tradeoff between leakage current due to direct tunneling current, and direct leakage current across the gate oxide to substrate.
As device gate oxide thickness becomes even thinner relative to gate lengths, charge trapping by defect states in the oxide may add to direct tunnel current. Such trapping may cause the gate electrode to lose its gate potential, resulting in what is known as a negative bias stress. When the gate electrode loses its gate potential, the leakage current continues at high current density levels, although it may not be at a leakage current in actual operation (e.g., a gate level). This condition may remain until gate potential is re-established.
In general, high current densities in the P-channel device region and the N-channel device region are to be avoided for high performance CMOS devices. For example, high current densities in NFET 100 result in extremely high drive currents which may cause latch-up of the MOSFET. ROME, June 15 (UPI) -- There may have been a second "Mummy," after all, U.S. researchers said Wednesday.

A team of American archaeologists and biologists announced the discovery of the skeleton of a previously unknown female mummy at a burial site in southeastern Egypt, near the town of Luxor.


The mummy, which was discovered in a stone sarcophagus, belongs to a woman who died during the Roman Empire and dates back to the third century.

Although the body was mummified by wrapping it up tightly in cloth, the team of American researchers said the mummy's remains appear to have been modified at some point for display.

The tomb belonged to a priestess of the goddess Hathor whose title was Sekhmet, or protector of the pharaoh, U.S. archaeologist Dr. Eileen Miller said.

"In fact, the hieroglyphic text is in the ancient Egyptian language, although English [translations] would be used for a translation on the walls," Miller said in a news release issued Wednesday.

"The funerary text is a prayer to the goddess," she explained.

It's unclear who was in charge of the burial.

"It's possible that someone from the priesthood took charge of this lady's burial," Miller said.

The team will continue to study and preserve the mummy's remains, and will try to identify the mummy's remains and date them.

"We still have a lot of work to do," Miller said.


Researchers will continue to study the remains and attempt to determine how the woman lived and how she died.

"This is really the only way to do that," she explained. "If you open the sarcophagus and you find nothing of value, then you're just spending your time and your money doing something that doesn't matter. We have more pressing things to do."

The researchers' findings will be published in the next issue of The Daily Telegraph.

Meanwhile, Miller said the mummy's discovery is still a fascinating find.

"She was a real person," she said. "This is the person people have been sending to us. We have been getting mail at the museum."

Glad-O-Gurt (disambiguation)

Glad-O-Gurt is a brand name for a vitamin and mineral supplements and a breakfast cereal. In the U.S., it is the brand name of a breakfast cereal for children made by Kellogg's and marketed under various name brands, such as its version which is manufactured by General Mills under the "Kids Choice" banner (e.g., "Glad-O-Gurt Original"). In Mexico, where it is produced and marketed by Nutrisa, it is packaged and sold as Gourmandina. In other English-speaking countries and its former colonies, it may be the brand name for cereal made by Nestlé. Some of the packaging of these products also features a smiling cartoon bear, whom some call "El Gourmandine." In French, it is marketed as a vitamin and mineral supplement and granola bar by Mars France as Gourmandine.

Glad-O-Gurt may also refer to:

 Glad O'Gurt Cottage Cheese, a cottage cheese product marketed as "Glad O'Gurt" for many years, made by the now defunct Sanitarium Company.
 Glad-O-Gurt, Texas, a ghost town on the Edwards Plateau in Burnet County, Texas, U.S.

See also 

 Glad Boy, a brand name for a line of cookies made by Nabisco in the 1960s
 Gourmand (disambiguation)
 Glade O'Gurt, a type of cereal originally sold in bags, and later boxes, by Nabisco.

The New York Times has an interesting article today by Adam Nossiter in which he interviews a few high school graduates in Florida in the midst of last week's storm. The students told Nossiter that they have to stay on the bus because "my teacher said I could't get off." They are bused to a school so that they don't fall behind in science and math or lose out in gym because the high school is over capacity.

While "over capacity" might have been the right phrase to use in 2003, it's difficult to argue that this is a true situation now. There is space for everyone to learn and it would be a poor decision to bus anyone out of a public school who is prepared to learn, except for the very few who are not prepared for the standards.

Nossiter notes that in Florida over the past 25 years the state has changed the way it assesses and compares students to one another, which has had the net effect of raising the proficiency test scores for black and Hispanic students, even though the racial composition of those who are actually attending schools has moved very little.

It’s not a very pretty chart. Black and Hispanic boys, and to a lesser extent, girls, have been lagging behind in public school for a quarter-century. While the public education system remains remarkably good at educating most of the population, particularly as compared with many places in the world, it is increasingly failing its students, particularly its black and Hispanic students.
