In June 2014, at around 7:30 p.m. EST, an alert was flashed to more than 20 million Americans and those with GPS on their cellphones.

“A ballistic missile was launched from North Korea and traveled over Japan,” the alert said in Korean and English.

Those words caused the North Korean panic.

“We are now ready to counter any kind of strike by the enemies whether it is a nuclear attack or a conventional attack,” Kim Jong Un, the leader of the ruling regime, said at a parade celebrating his military’s “victory” over the South in front of a massive, roaring crowd.

And they were armed to the teeth with the same type of nuclear weaponry — the very best in the world.

Kim and the Pentagon have been waging a war of words since last week and no amount of spin or bravado can disguise that fact.

The rhetoric has only grown more heated as China has sought to cool tensions — while also showing its displeasure with some of Washington’s actions.

“He knows very well that China is very upset about the U.S. missile defense system and that the U.S. is trying to change the strategic situation in the Korean Peninsula,” said Yang Moo-jin, a professor at the University of North Korean Studies in Seoul.

On Sunday, Beijing said that all countries, including South Korea, should oppose “all forms of nuclear tests,” and that North Korea would have to take the path that is “appropriate and peaceful.”

It certainly would have come as no surprise if the North Korean regime took advantage of the Chinese statement to test an intercontinental ballistic missile that can hit U.S. cities such as Chicago and New York.

It’s not uncommon for the North Koreans to talk tough. They believe it gives them leverage on the world stage and a sense of security that the Pentagon would otherwise try to destroy them.

“The North Korean military is well trained in handling a large-scale military operation and has a massive arsenal of conventional weapons,” Bruce Klingner, a senior research fellow at the Heritage Foundation, told FoxNews.com. “In addition (to their) huge investment (in nuclear capabilities), the military has the largest standing army in the world.”

Their conventional weapons may frighten, but it has never mattered.

(CNN) -- The woman who played Santa Claus in Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade "I can't think of any other way to do it," parade executive Jay Roskill says.

"It's a tradition that's had to continue for hundreds of years," Roskill says of the "Little Red Dress of Santa Costume." Eighty-year-old Dorothy Manhart's red dress has graced Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade floats for the last 20 years.

So it is with reluctance that Roskill says Dorothy's day is ending.

"It's very difficult to watch those little girls go up to her and say, 'Hello, Santa, where's my candy cane?' And the last time I saw her [in 2005], for the last time, they were pulling little girls up to the front of the float and trying to give them a hug," Roskill says. "It was kind of hard."

Dorothy is too ill to continue and will be replaced by a man, Roskill says.

1. Field of the Invention
The present invention relates to a portable tool that measures, among others, the angle of the neck of a human neck portion, and includes a headband provided with a first angle measuring module that is in direct proximity to the neck. The first angle measuring module, which is associated to an optical measuring module for determining the angular position of the angle measuring module, which itself is provided on a headband, is arranged to measure with respect to at least two head positions defined by a user of a first headband and when such first headband is moved around and/or lifted from the neck portion of the human, which is connected to other body portions. In particular, the angle of the neck portion is obtained in connection to the headband angle corresponding to the neck position. A second angle and/or other geometrical characteristics that depend on the first headband and the other body parts may be measured when the head band is lifted and/or moved with respect to the neck portion.
2. Description of the Related Art
The present invention relates to a tool that measures an angular position of a human neck including an angular measuring system of the aforesaid type that uses one and the same headband, which comprises one and the same optical head measuring module, and two measuring modules arranged to measure a position of the headband relative to the neck itself and/or a position of the headband relative to the other parts of the human being.
From the state of the art there are known devices which are used for measuring the position of a patient's head. Such devices comprise an apparatus which comprises a first device having a first headrest for supporting a patient's head, a second device for being in proximity to the first device and being connected thereto, and a processor. The processor determines angular movement of the first device relative to the second device.
However, with devices of the aforesaid type it may be desirable to also determine the angular position of the head relative to the body. It is also desirable to measure other characteristics of the neck angle, such as the angle of the neck, the length of the neck and/or the length of the neck protruding between the jaw joints. Also, the head position relative to the neck may constitute different neck positions.

The latest news in the world of private equity.

Hedge fund Blackstone announced a $200 million investment in The Broadwick Hill Group, a U.K.-based private equity firm focused on consumer, retail and commercial finance. The deal will help The Broadwick Hill Group with financing opportunities for its European assets. “We look forward to further strengthening our relationship with Blackstone and we are excited about the growth opportunities we will be able to create,” Blackstone partner and CEO of The Broadwick Hill Group, Anthony Leggatt, said in a press release. Broadwick Hill is the investment vehicle of private equity firm Warburg Pincus, which was founded in 2000 by the Broadwick Hill Group. “I’m also very excited about the business we will generate for our shareholders, including Warburg Pincus, in the U.K., given the strength of our investment team, and in particular, our strong relationships with a number of key banking institutions here.” The Broadwick Hill Group was the winner of this year’s IPC Private Equity Deal of the Year award.

Carbonite, a cloud backup service that was co-founded in 2003 by John Casner and John F. Walsh, announced today the closing of a second round of financing, for $35 million. The Series B investment was led by TPG Growth and other leading institutional investors, including New Enterprise Associates, Benchmark Capital, IVP, Intel Capital, Kleiner Perkins, NEA, and Pinnacle Venture Capital Management. “The company has taken the best of the best in cloud technologies and combined them into a truly compelling offering that can help enterprise organizations, both large and small, better protect their key assets,” said Paul Cormier, director of private investments in TPG. “We now look forward to helping the company take the next step in its execution.” Carbonite was previously backed by New Enterprise Associates (NEA), Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers (KPCB), and General Catalyst Partners.

Hedge fund Cerberus Capital said it will sell its stake in a company with its best-known business, Time Warner Cable. Cerberus owns a 26.3 percent stake in the cable provider. Cerberus’ stake in Time Warner Cable has been steadily declining in recent years; in 2008, the firm acquired nearly half of Time Warner for $70.4 billion. The FT-IR and FT-Raman spectra of 4-propylcatechol (4PC) obtained from the Gaussian 09 program have been performed to calculate frequency distribution and vibrational assignments. Vibrational frequency calculations demonstrate that the vibrational frequencies are obtained from a small basis set with 6-311++G(d,p) level and a large basis set, as complete basis set using 6-31++G(d,p). Furthermore, potential energy distribution analysis (PEDA) revealed that the lowest-energy transition is a combination of n → σ* with one weakly coupled OH stretching vibration and C-C stretching vibration. The optimized geometric parameters, the HOMO-LUMO energy level and vibrational frequencies showed that 4PC is a polar molecule. The B3LYP/6-311++G(d,p) method has been used to assign the vibrational modes of 4PC. The geometrical parameters indicate that the molecules can exist in π-bond. The vibrational assignment of the molecules was done by the potential Energy Distribution Analysis (PEDA) and normal coordinate analysis (NCA) and with the help of the total energy distribution of the vibrational modes which was obtained by the second moment of frequency using the Vibration Analysis Program (GAUSSIAN 09). The vibrational modes and the corresponding vibrational assignment are in good agreement with the available literatures.

The effects of different levels of theophylline, a putative stimulant of noradrenergic function, on plasma hormone and lactate in human males and females.
The administration of theophylline has been shown to increase plasma catecholamines and lactate in man. In the present study the effects of 100 mg/kg theophylline on these variables was compared with those following either 30 mg/kg or 200 mg/kg. In males, theophylline, in doses which have been used in the laboratory to treat asthma, did not appear to be a particularly effective stimulant. The mean increase in plasma noradrenaline after the administration of 300 mg theophylline was only 5 ng/100 ml plasma, compared with a mean increase of about 18 ng/100 ml plasma following administration of 8 mg/kg ephedrine. The increase in plasma noradrenaline following administration of 30 mg theophylline was of the same magnitude as that following 10 mg/kg ephedrine. However, the effect of the low and high doses of theophylline in females was slightly greater than that of the lower doses of ephedrine. Mean increases in plasma adrenaline and lactate following the administration of theophylline were also slightly less than those found following similar doses of ephedrine.

Pasquale's Law

The Pasquale's Law was a decision in the Supreme Court of the United States, that the Federal Government lacks the power to tax individuals that live and work in a foreign country.

Pasquale was a longshoreman who had worked on steamships in foreign countries and then moved to the US to work on another ship. Because he was not physically present in the US, the Internal Revenue Service did not tax him. He challenged this, claiming as he had a legal domicile in the country of destination at the end of his working hours.

The Court ruled that he did have a legal domicile, but that under the Federal government cannot tax the individual. Under the Constitution, the Federal government has the power to tax "natural born citizens", not aliens or foreigners.

References

When we get that call from the vet and are told that our 3-week-old puppy hasn’t been eating for 24 hours straight, we often have a tendency to freak out. My husband and I both have panic attacks over the fact that we might have to put away our puppy. There is nothing more heartbreaking for me than having to see him go away to boarding. So, the question is: What will it really take to make your puppy comfortable?

We got Sadie (a 4 month Old Australian Lab X) from a breeder in South Florida and brought her back to Virginia. Sadie was born with a birth defect in her heart and in January of 2012, underwent her first surgery. In April 2012, her sister (Tina) and brother (Hank) were born. From the beginning of 2012 until she was eight weeks old, Sadie was constantly uncomfortable and cried constantly for several months. We thought that it was just a baby thing.

It wasn’t.

Once she could actually put food into her mouth and started eating on her own, Sadie’s health deteriorated. With each passing day with her in our home, we slowly began to notice that she wasn’t running like she should be, she was losing weight, she didn’t like to play, and she was constantly snoring.

Sadie was sick with pneumonia for a month and a half because it took so much out of her to even get up and walk. By that point, we knew that we had to get to the bottom of what was happening to Sadie. It seems that we had a very, very sick little girl in our home.

In May of 2012, we finally took her to the vet and were advised that if we didn’t remove her from our home her condition was only going to get worse because her immune system was being suppressed. The vet told us that we needed to take her to the facility we had talked about, but that it was a long haul because all of her procedures would require sedation.

After a series of tests, a round of radiation on her chest, multiple blood draws and multiple scans, we knew that the only solution was to put Sadie away.

And I did not have “a freaking panic attack.”

VATICAN CITY -- Pope Francisco on Tuesday urged people around the world to "share the love of God" and turn away from violence, urging leaders to be models of respect for others.

Francis also told members of the Roman Senate to use their power in a just way.

Francis's plea came after the pope's decision last week to suspend Cardinal Theodore McCarrick from public ministry -- after the U.S.-born prelate was accused of serial sexual abuse -- as well as Cardinal Donald Wuerl of Washington and the Rev. Marcial Maciel Degollado, a Mexican priest who became famous as a religious leader of the 1980s.

Vatican spokesman Greg Burke said the pope wanted to call attention to the need to avoid violence.

"To share God's love, we cannot do with lies," the pope said in his general audience in St. Peter's Square. "We have to be truthful in order to build a peaceful world... We don't build peace by making war."

Get Breaking News Delivered to Your Inbox

Francis said this in answer to the question of a member of the diplomatic corps.

Francis also told the senators that while Rome's political life is sometimes rough, it's not always dirty, and "this is what I ask of you." He called for an end to political turmoil in Brazil and Venezuela and to the "arrogant discourse that seeks to reduce others to mere political categories."

Last month Francis removed Cardinal Blase Cupich of Chicago, leader of the U.S. conference of bishops, from the office of chief Vatican theologian after the cardinal voiced his support for a U.S. ban on the use of the term "climate change," rather than "global warming."

He made his remarks in English, while Vatican officials said he was speaking in Italian.

I’ve been following the news this week on the latest outbreak of Ebola in the Democratic Republic of Congo, but to be honest, I’d forgotten all about it until I saw this tweet.

The World Health Organization has confirmed the presence of #Ebola in the Democratic Republic of Congo. #Congo has no confirmed cases of #Ebola. — World Health Organization (@WHO) August 28, 2013

Yes, the Congo has no confirmed cases of Ebola. But the WHO says it has no confirmed cases of Ebola. Which brings me to the point of this blog post: WHO can’t confirm the absence of an infectious disease. It’s not a fact, it’s just not true.

The claim that the WHO can’t prove the absence of a disease was also made (or something equivalent) in the news reports that I read. Now, a disease can be perfectly well-known for a particular illness or ailment and at the same time be quite rare globally. In that case people will just think you are being clever or funny. I don’t know. I hope I’m being clever or funny, but I’m not sure of the answer to that. (Maybe I am being both, but I still don’t know.) It’s also worth remembering that some people just dislike the WHO for obscure doctrinal reasons.

It shouldn’t, but there it is. To be absolutely precise, the world has never heard of Ebola, yet it exists. The world thinks it’s not possible, therefore it doesn’t exist. Well, that’s true of the world in general, but Ebola really exists, it’s been a real problem in the past, it’s continuing to be a serious disease right now, and it’s likely that it’s going to remain a real problem in the future.

Maybe the virus will disappear with the next flu season? Perhaps by the time it takes a third bite of fruit from a contaminated plant it will just be an old, forgotten problem. There is no need to panic; the world will just get over Ebola and it will carry on carrying on, as we have gotten used to doing. That’s how life is – diseases come and go. Eventually they are forgotten and everything goes on as before.

I don’t pretend to know everything. Nor do

Borussia Dortmund, who sit 13 points adrift of Premier League leaders Arsenal, took their frustration over last week’s penalty shoot-out defeat to Wolfsburg on to the pitch in the most memorable of ways, and they left in a blaze of glory: an 8-1 win on Sunday in Germany.

The result, however, is only a temporary halt to their descent into mediocrity. It is a rare occurrence to beat a top-six side at home in the Bundesliga, never mind to win such a match by eight goals, so Dortmund’s supporters will be wondering whether a run of away fixtures will return their team to its former glory of recent seasons.

The league table still has Dortmund fourth, but with two games in hand on the leaders, and their poor away record this season, they will be concerned over their next group of fixtures – they have an embarrassing home victory over the league’s bottom two and will face the league leaders, Bayern Munich away this season.

Their performance on Sunday was reminiscent of the way they were dismantled at the Vicente Calderon in March 2010 – Dortmund were left humiliated 6-2 by the likes of Real Madrid and Barcelona, as they suffered their first post-Borussia Mönchengladbach away loss in more than a year.

Dortmund struggled to score against Wolfsburg and despite producing their most impressive performance since returning to the Bundesliga in 1998, they still cannot get the rub of the green when it matters. They look a shadow of their former selves after two seasons in the Bundesliga.

After the last-gasp defeat to Mönchengladbach, the club’s sporting director Michael Zorc admitted that “there are times in the season when you play not very well but there is not a single reason for this.

“I’m not saying that you do not get a result. You get a result, but it is not decisive.”

Wolfsburg’s home advantage can hardly be blamed for the result, nor their quality of opponents – it was the ninth lowest-scoring Bundesliga match of the season, but Dortmund still ended up winning by eight, scoring three times in each half.

Dortmund must take responsibility, and they must improve at their Bongarts/Bonnier Stadium, where this loss was their second after last week’s 4-2 defeat to Bayern Munich.

1. Field of the Invention
The invention relates to a method and device for analyzing speech of a telephone subscriber, a speech analyzer, an integrated speech analyzer, and a speech analyzer system which can detect a speech pattern for the purpose of discriminating a call from a long-distance call among a plurality of call originations transmitted by a subscriber to a switching station.
2. Description of the Related Art
In recent years, there are increasing demands for speech analyzing services for the purpose of providing speech services and speech analyzing services for preventing improper use of telecommunications services. There is a method for determining call originations based upon the analysis of a speech transmitted by a subscriber. However, a subscriber may cause a communication with a wrong destination. It would be good to discriminate a call originating with a wrong destination as well as a call originating from long distance by speech analysis.
For that purpose, some conventional methods for discriminating a call from a long distance use a distance between acoustic characteristics of a speech and a speech analyzing time, a ratio of fundamental frequency of a speech to total fundamental frequency, a pattern of word and sentence-break, an interval between a speech and a silence. These conventional methods are, however, based on the following premises.
1 A telephone subscriber transmits speech.
2 The speech is subjected to analysis and a comparison with a dictionary.
3 A speech originating from the vicinity is discriminated from that originating from a long distance.
The method disclosed in Japanese Patent Disclosure (Kokai) Nos. 2-288925 and 2-288926 is based upon these premises and detects whether or not the distance between an analysis result and a pre-stored reference characteristic is within a predetermined range. The method disclosed in Japanese Patent Disclosure (Kokai) No. 6-291755 has an arrangement wherein an acoustic parameter (fundamental frequency, noise ratio, pause ratio, and pitch) obtained from a speech signal is compared with a corresponding parameter of a pre-stored reference characteristic, whereby a call originated within the same neighborhood as the pre-stored reference characteristic is discriminated from a call originated from a long distance.
For all of the above-mentioned conventional methods, a characteristic value is detected using speech obtained from the telephone subscriber, and a comparison is made with a pre-stored reference characteristic value, thus producing results depending on the telephone subscriber's ability or the state of environmental noise present when a speech is transmitted. Lipopolysaccharide-induced acute septic shock in the rat: effect of endotoxin, phage, saline and naloxone on blood pressure and heart rate.
The effect of endotoxin from the outer membrane of gram-negative bacteria on blood pressure and heart rate (HR) in conscious adult Sprague-Dawley rats was studied. Injection of 5 micrograms/kg i.v. endotoxin caused a rise in blood pressure of 60 +/- 10 mm Hg 30 min after administration. Lower doses were ineffective; higher doses produced cardiac and respiratory arrest. The duration of pressor response of the first dose of endotoxin was 1.5 +/- 0.1 min (10 micrograms/kg i.v.); after the end of the response, the heart rate was at control level, i.e., significantly less than the control value of approximately 320 beats/min maintained by the baroreceptors. A 2 h pretreatment with 5 micrograms/kg endotoxin failed to induce any additional effects in blood pressure, HR, plasma levels of catecholamines, or levels of acetylcholine in the central nervous system. Pretreated endotoxin failed to induce tachycardia and hypertension in awake rats receiving naloxone at 15 mg/kg i.v. at the peak response to endotoxin. Phage-K decreased peak blood pressure and HR and was approximately twofold less potent than endotoxin in producing the same effects. Pretreatment with phage-K at the same dose as endotoxin and 1 h before phage-K failed to alter the subsequent tachycardia and hypertension induced by endotoxin. These findings support the validity of an i.v. route of administration of endotoxin in the conscious rat. Pretreatment of animals with endotoxin does not enhance the vascular responses to the toxin and, even when tested alone, had no effect on physiological parameters evaluated. Phage that bind and neutralize endotoxin (e.g., phage-K) did not induce hemodynamic changes seen with endotoxin in the conscious rat.

Vladimir Putin and Narendra Modi at the BRICS summit in Johannesburg, South Africa, in July 2014. Photo: Reuters

A senior Russian official says that if Narendra Modi's Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has won the elections in India, Moscow will consider extending visa-free travel to New Delhi's citizens in 2014.

"If the Indian elections are free and fair, I think we should discuss the possibility of extending visa-free travel," Deputy Foreign Minister Sergey Ryabkov told the BBC at a news conference in Moscow on Saturday. (Reuters contributed to this story.)

Last July, Narendra Modi won India's elections to form the first non-Congress government in 23 years.

The BJP, led by the controversial candidate, is set to form a government with a majority of seats in parliament if the current alliance holds.

Mr. Ryabkov stressed that relations between Mr. Putin's Russia and India were currently on the same "high level as ever". He also said that India is the largest trading partner for Russian agricultural produce and that both nations trade with one another.

However, Mr. Ryabkov also expressed concern about India's ties with Russia's traditional foe, Pakistan. India has long accused Pakistan of providing a sanctuary for Kashmiri militants to launch attacks on Indian soldiers.

In an unprecedented tit for tat, Indian jets struck a Pakistani military forward post in Indian Kashmir on Wednesday morning, and reportedly destroyed an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV), following Islamabad downing Indian fighter jets in February 1999.

Both nations claim their respective enclaves in Kashmir to be legitimate, and have engaged in a proxy war in the mountainous region that straddles their borders.

Mr. Ryabkov stressed that he was not aware of military plans by Pakistani officials to launch a pre-emptive operation in Kashmir.

But he added that Russian intelligence sources were monitoring the escalating tensions, and that these recent developments had forced Moscow to increase its military presence along the disputed border.

(With Reuters)

This article was originally published on GlobalPost. Its content was removed at the request of GlobalPost.

[Role of echography in detecting the presence of cervical spondylosis].
The authors present a prospective clinical study involving the evaluation of 35 patients with neck pain. In these patients cervical spine lesions were diagnosed by means of X-ray examination, myelography and myelography/CT (1-1). In 20 patients with neck pain of a non-specific character, all of whom complained of mild subjective symptoms, no abnormal finding was detected by echography and cervical myelography. Echographic findings showed abnormalities in 5 patients. X-ray revealed abnormalities in 4 patients with mild to moderate clinical lesions of cervical vertebral structure (2 type II, 1 type I, 1 type II/III). On account of the finding which echography and cervical myelography enabled to make, CT was utilized in all 5 cases. The authors comment on the role of echography in the diagnostic process, in the pre-operative phase and, mainly, during the post-operative phase.

	# dvdiff is not installed: do without it
	exit 0
fi

	# vcdiff_doc is not installed: find a diff doc and fall back
	# on vcdiff_doc for now. The diff may not be very clear.
	# We have to get the current diff from the website.
	DIFF=$(wget -c -O - http://dvdiff.donsbot.com/diff.txt)
	grep -a "^Diff:\s*\$" $DIFF > $DATADIR/diff.txt
	DIFF=`sed -n 1p $DATADIR/diff.txt`
	if [ -z "$DIFF" ] ; then
		# nothing found, fallback
		DIFF=`vcdiff_doc > $DATADIR/diff.txt 2>&1`
		SOURCE=
	else

	fi
	if [! -r "$SOURCE" ] ; then
		echo "unable to find download for vcdiff doc"
		SOURCE=""
	else
		# the diff is in the doc directory
		SOURCE=$PREFIX/share/doc/vcdiff/$SOURCE
	fi
fi

Mild traumatic brain injury in relation to risk of major depressive disorder: Results from a population based cohort study.
The incidence of major depressive disorder (MDD) increased among post-September 11, 2001 (9/11) World Trade Center (WTC) responders who experienced mild traumatic brain injuries (MTBI) in the years following 9/11. This study explored the cumulative and prospective relationships between MTBI and subsequent MDD in a community-based cohort of 2,634 men and women. A Cox proportional hazards model was used to estimate the effect of MTBI on MDD risk at various time points after study entry. Adjusted hazard ratios (aHRs) for incident MDD ranged from 1.34 (95% confidence interval [CI], 0.86-2.10) at 12 months after 9/11 to 2.12 (95% CI, 1.23-3.64) at 28 months after 9/11. MTBI and MDD had a cumulative and prospective dose-response effect, even when accounting for other possible mediators of the MTBI-MDD association. These findings suggest that the increased MDD risk among 9/11 responders was not fully explained by other variables available in this study.

Prove the norm is strictly increasing for a compact set in $\mathbb{C}^N$

Let $K \subset \mathbb{C}^N$ be compact and non-empty and let $u \in \mathbb{C}^N$ be such that $\lVert u \rVert_2 = 1$.
I want to show $u \in K$ and $1 \leq \lVert u \rVert_2$ in these cases.
My first idea was to prove that $K$ is closed and bounded, because if two continuous functions are equal on the boundary, they have to be equal everywhere. This fails, because it does not hold for compact sets.

Python - Find a substring in a file and print it

Is there a way for me to find a substring in a file and print the results?
I have made this so far, but it won't print the results correctly.
fileName = open("test2.txt", "r")
print (fileName)
for line in fileName:
    if "123test" in line:
        print (line)
        break

A:

Use str.find('str') to find the substrings in the string, after this get the line number from the start index of the substring in the string.
import re
with open("test2.txt", "r") as i:
    for line in i:
        print(re.find('123test', line))

EDIT, using re.sub:
import re
with open("test2.txt", "r") as i:
    for line in i:
        line = re.findall(r'123test', line)[0]
        print(line)

DEMO.

The present invention relates to methods for the identification and purification of a tumor-associated carbohydrate antigen (TAC1).
Tumor associated carbohydrate antigens (TAC) are carbohydrate moieties present in various glycoproteins and glycolipids that are present on the cell surface of most cancers.
Examples of TAC include the carbohydrates found on the mucin MUC2, a major glycoprotein which is synthesized by normal epithelial cells with gastric, pancreatic, and breast origin and found associated with adhesions and desmoplasia in colon, breast, prostate, and ovarian cancer tissues. Tissue expression of MUC2 is highly restricted in normal tissues, whereas it is markedly upregulated in neoplastic tissues in breast cancer, where it is also a biomarker of aggressive tumor types (Blanchet, R. et al., Cancer Res 63:898-905, 2003). While MUC2 expression is well-characterized immunohistochemically, in situ expression of human MUC2 has been described in adenocarcinomas but not in normal colonic mucosa (Mazarin, C. M. et al., Cancer Res 54:4832-4835, 1994). In pancreatic cancer, the glycoprotein MUC5AC is also a marker of cancer; in an immunohistochemical study of 88 pancreatic biopsies, MUC5AC was expressed in 81%. The association of MUC5AC with advanced malignancies was described in two studies. In the first, MUC5AC overexpressed pancreatic cancers were not associated with a favorable prognosis (Nordstrom, E. et al., Int J Surg Pathol 21:59-63, 2005). In the second study, both MUC5AC expression and high-grade tumors (grade III) were associated with a high mortality (Petersen, M. R. et al., Tumour Biol 25:2239-2246, 2004).
Another TAC is the sialyl Lewis X antigen, an epitope that is present on the carbohydrate moieties of a number of glycoproteins and glycolipids which is sialylated by the addition of either N-acetyl-galactosamine or N-acetyl-neuraminic acid. Lewisx antigen expression is found in more than 50% of breast cancers.

Greetings!

Hi! We’re a team of researchers on the GOV.UK redesign, and I’d like to introduce you to a new tool called UCDB.

The GOV.UK redesign was a huge task. Its ambitious scope meant that many parts of the redesign had to be undertaken by different teams of people. It has therefore been a while since we’ve been able to provide regular and regular updates on the state of the redesign. So, I thought I’d write a summary of what we’ve been doing, and where we are now, in a blog post!

First, to give some context, here’s the original GOV.UK. I’m not going to discuss it in too much detail – it’s in the public domain, so anybody who wants to know more can read it themselves. The important thing to understand is that there are big gaps, and we’ve only really started work on filling those gaps.

Here is the revised GOV.UK. This isn't something we’ve actually started to complete yet, but at the time of writing, it's only missing some core content, some important navigation features, and some of the brand identity. The next post on this blog will discuss the current priorities for implementing specific functionality in the revised GOV.UK.

Now a description.

UCDB or User-Centric Data Browser is a tool we’re developing to help the different groups of people involved with the GOV.UK redesign make decisions about what exactly to implement, and to see the impact of those decisions. It’s a tool I’m developing to meet the needs of the people who are making those decisions, that’s all.

UCDB is basically a webapp where you can input data about the specific kind of data you’re thinking about. You get to see a visualisation of that data and can make decisions about what the best course of action might be.

The tool is being developed with a team that I’ve been leading since the very start of the project, but has now reached independent status and is developing on its own now.

We’re starting with five core kinds of data, that we’re thinking about covering in more detail over time:

Curation. What information is produced in GOV.UK, and for what

Q:

Does the order of arguments matter for fopen in the constructor?

The man pages say: 

You should use the most permissive open mode in the early stages and the strictest mode in the later stages: otherwise you may corrupt the file in case it exists and is opened by another process or on a different filesystem.

Should the open mode be first argument when opening a file or second?
Is there a case where it is better to take it second while opening a big file?
Does it matter for the permissions?
I am trying to be more general. In which order should arguments be passed if at all?

A:

Since fopen() has the signature:
int fopen( const char *filename, const char *mode );

No arguments should go after filename.  If you do use mode arguments, they should be the 3rd and 4th.
Note that this can be considered to be the only way to use mode arguments, but there are others.  For example, the old way to do this:
FILE* fp = fopen( "file", "r" );
fp = fopen( "file", "r", "b" );
// Do something with fp
fclose( fp );

is now considered unsafe due to the presence of a security flaw.
However, some developers do still write their own versions of the library function because it is too difficult to port across to the new API. Thus, the C library can be backward-incompatible without any users of the library receiving any warnings or errors.

Syracuse, N.Y. --- Nearly a year after a New York judge overturned a proposed merger of American Bancorp and National City Corp., New York's banking department on Tuesday took a different view of how the companies would be governed, calling for a board-level agreement between National City and American's largest holding company, First Bank, to approve that relationship.

American and National City previously merged in the first half of 2015. But the merger was halted last year after First Bank, the largest shareholder in National City, sued to block the transaction.

First Bank wants to keep its subsidiary National Bank of Michigan out of the American system. American's banking department, in turn, wants a special banking board to oversee and regulate the acquisition while not requiring the approval of First Bank or American's other major shareholder, Citigroup Inc.

A spokesman with the banking department did not provide a timetable for the state to consider the deal. First Bank did not respond to requests for comment on this story.

New York state Supreme Court Judge Ruth Pickholz ruled in June that a merger between American and National City violated "one of New York's central banking laws" and needed to be reconsidered after a more intensive review. She declined at the time to force the state's banking department to approve the merger.

New York's banking department, however, did not rule out merging the two companies again should First Bank and American and Citigroup agree to a plan for the acquisition. But it did not want to have to wait more than one and a half years before considering a new transaction.

Today the WHO confirmed the disease was on the brink of elimination, but in some West African countries many of its residents never seemed to hear the news. The disease has spread to neighboring Liberia where it claimed one of its first fatal victims.

Liberia’s President Ernest Bai Koroma said today that the country was taking the Ebola crisis “very seriously” in line with a promise given to the international community as the outbreak was brought under control four months ago. Koroma spoke at a news conference just outside the Liberian capital, Monrovia, after visiting a local hospital where a person died of Ebola.

It also emerged today that the head of the country’s Ebola containment unit was sacked over a dispute with medical staff over the unit’s strategy.

On Monday the head of Liberia’s Health Ministry, Samuel William Bodie, told the BBC he had been instructed to shut down facilities dedicated to containing Ebola because their focus had shifted to more urgent cases.

Since May, a team from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has been sent to help West Africa’s weak health sector to fight Ebola, which causes a hemorrhagic fever and kills 50 percent of those infected. It was not clear when a team of American military personnel was to arrive.

The WHO’s regional director for Africa, Dr. Oukouo Bangoura, said the disease was still a threat and called for the need to provide basic health services to the communities hardest hit by Ebola. In conventional computerized speech-recognition systems, speech data is typically stored on a medium such as a Compact Disc (CD) to be transferred to a computer so that the speech-recognition application can be used. A phoneme is typically a smallest meaningful sound, such as a vowel, a consonant, or any combination of the two. The term “computer-generated speech (CGS)” is sometimes used to collectively refer to the variety of speech-synthesis techniques that are based on speech that is generated by the computer.
The CGS approach typically involves converting a verbal string of speech into a string of speech data by converting strings of digits and/or non-digit strings into speech data. The resulting speech data is then sent to a speech recognizer, such as a “Dragon” speech recognition system, commercially available from EDS Corporation of Redwood City, Calif. or “Targett,” commercially available from Speech Works, Inc. of St. Louis, Mo.
Examples of verbal strings that typically are used in the CGS approach include the letters of the alphabet, telephone numbers, street names and restaurant names.

Efficacy of nabilone for opioid detoxification in cancer patients: Double-blind, placebo-controlled, crossover study.
This double-blind, single-center, randomized, placebo-controlled, crossover study sought to determine the safety, tolerability, and efficacy of 5 mg nabilone for opioid detoxification among patients with cancer and chronic opioid use. This study was approved by the local Institutional Review Board and was conducted in an inpatient hospice/quarantine unit. Patients with a history of opioid use who were diagnosed with cancer and were receiving palliative care and receiving opioid therapy were included. The primary outcome was self-report of opioid withdrawal severity, as assessed by the Subjective Opioid Withdrawal Scale--4th version. The study evaluated 25 patients in total, with a mean age of 52 years and male/female ratio of 16:9. After randomization, nabilone patients reported significantly fewer withdrawal episodes (mean [SEM]), 6.9 [0.93], than placebo patients, 22.6 [2.85], at the study endpoint (P <.001), indicating that nabilone effectively reduced withdrawal. Nabilone patients described a lower self-report of overall opioid withdrawal symptoms (P =.02) and their pain severity at the study endpoint (P =.005) than placebo patients. No other safety or tolerability results differed between nabilone and placebo patients. Nabilone appears to be an effective and safe adjunct to opioid withdrawal therapy with potential use as a potential adjunctive treatment for opioid withdrawal in clinical care.

Find the number of subsets of {n} in the range (a,b)?

In a set of integers, what is the number of ways to separate a subset of n elements with an integer in the range $(a,b)$?
That is, how many ordered subsets are there with $n$ elements, in which element are $a$ to $b$?
What is the reasoning behind such a problem?
E.g. what is the answer for $\{4,3,2,1\}$ given $a = 3$ and $b = 7$?

A:

Let $p_n$ be the number of ordered subsets of size $n$. Then
$$\sum_{n\ge1}^{\infty}2^np_n=\frac{2\cdot4\cdot2\cdot...(4m)!}{4^{2m}(m!)^2}$$
We can interpret this sum as counting the number of ways you can place $2m$ distinct objects into $4m$ distinguish places, giving the sum. Now we can calculate $p_n$ by the principle of inclusion and exclusion.

A:

To put it simply:
Let $a_{k}=a$, where $k\in [1,\ldots b]$ is an index, and
$$\{1,2,\ldots,b\}/\{k\}=A_k$$
We have that these groups are distinguishable by the index $k$, such that all $k$-neighborhoods of $k$ are within a neighborhood in $A$.
So for every $k$, by inclusion and exclusion we have
$$p_k=2^{a-k}\cdot k-\sum_{k<l<2k}(2l-k)2^{k-l-1}\cdot l$$
whereby we have for $k=1$
$$=a2^{a-1}-\sum_{k<l<2k}2^{k-l-1}\cdot 2l$$
and for $k=2$
$$=2a2^{a-2}-\sum_{k<l<2k}(2l-k)2^{k-l-1}\cdot

Titanium has long been recognized as an attractive metal for use in many industrial applications, and titanium alloys having specific compositions and properties have been developed for such use. In many cases, titanium alloys have the ability to exhibit high strength and good formability. Unfortunately, however, titanium and titanium alloys in a variety of forms often possess a high affinity for oxidizing contaminants in the atmosphere or the surface of a workpiece. This results in a loss of ductility due to the formation of a surface layer of passive, brittle, thin and very tough oxide. While this oxide is usually substantially transparent, it can affect the appearance and corrosion resistance of the titanium-containing workpiece. Therefore, when using titanium and titanium alloys, techniques for inhibiting the formation of oxidation are required. The two most common methods of improving titanium alloy performance have been the inclusion of rare-earth elements and the inclusion of other alloys such as steel and other iron elements. However, these components increase cost of titanium and titanium alloy products.
Other methods of improving titanium's performance that have been explored include additions of elements of known anticorrosion properties. Thus, for example, phosphorus was known to improve the corrosion resistance of titanium alloys, so that when phosphorus is added to titanium and titanium alloy to improve the corrosion resistance, the surface will be less passive and less prone to oxidation. U.S. Pat. No. 3,842,009 describes one group of titanium alloys which incorporate phosphorus into the titanium matrix. The phosphorus can be incorporated by making the titanium powder phosphorothermically and then subsequently hot-pressing the powder into the desired product. The phosphide forms during the heat treating step, and the chemical potential of phosphorus is altered, thereby reducing the tendency of phosphorus to react.
U.S. Pat. No. 4,663,374 describes the addition of magnesium to titanium to inhibit the formation of a passive, thin oxide coating on the surface of the titanium alloy. Magnesium can be incorporated into the titanium by way of an alloying element, and magnesium is known to be a strong corrosion inhibitor. U.S. Pat. No. 3,947,356 describes the inclusion of magnesium to titanium in the composition, resulting in a titanium alloy which is useful in heat treating applications. In these applications, magnesium functions as a deoxidizing element. Take precautions

While natural disasters can sometimes turn deadly, they can also spark medical emergencies that can require immediate attention.

A comparison of the effects of topical application of capsaicin, capsinoids (capsaicin analogues) and capsazepine on facial cold pain in healthy young volunteers.
Topical application of capsaicin and capsinoids causes analgesia in experimental pain conditions in humans and animals. To determine at what concentration capsaicin exerts its topical analgesic effect and compare its effect to capsinoids with that of a reference compound, capsazepine, in relieving experimental cold pain in the hairy skin of fingers. We used cold plates to assess experimental cold pain threshold and the area of painful heat perception, and capsaicin and capsinoid (capsaicin analogue) cream to produce analgesia; capsazepine cream was used as a reference. The analgesics were applied to the volar aspects of 15 healthy male and 5 healthy female volunteers aged 27-43 years during a baseline measurement, followed by two to five 10-minute exposures to capsaicin, capsinoids, and capsazepine on different days, at randomised concentrations of between 11 and 454 microg/cm2. During the last minute of exposure, cold pain threshold increased in all three groups. The response magnitude was greatest for capsaicin, and was of similar magnitude for capsinoids and capsazepine. Capsaicin, capsinoids, and capsazepine reduce experimental cold pain thresholds when applied in concentrations at or below 50 microg/cm2. Topical application of 50 microg/cm2 capsaicin, capsinoids, or capsazepine produces similar analgesia to each other and to 100 microg/cm2 capsaicin, which is the maximally effective concentration for painful cold pain relief in humans.

Mildly hypothyroidism at late onset: an indication for levothyroxine replacement?
Euthyroid sick syndrome is the diagnosis that may be applied to patients with late onset hypothyroidism. These patients develop symptoms that mimic those of the overt hypothyroid state, and may present with atypical clinical manifestations or complications, such as diabetes mellitus. Hypothyroidism can also coexist with other endocrine disorders. The cause of euthyroid sick syndrome remains incompletely established. It has been suggested that patients with euthyroid sick syndrome may be hypothyroid, and therefore the diagnosis of euthyroid sick syndrome should be made with caution. The present study investigated whether levothyroxine treatment is justified in mild hypothyroidism of the late-onset euthyroid sick syndrome. Sixteen patients (six men and 10 women) with hypothyroidism were treated with levothyroxine. The subjects had mild hypothyroidism with low free T(4) levels. The diagnosis of hypothyroidism depended on clinical signs, blood TSH levels, and results of laboratory evaluation. After the beginning of levothyroxine treatment, thyroid-stimulating-hormone levels were checked twice a month with the same assay method and showed satisfactory elevation after 3 months in all cases. Patients were divided into four groups, based on the results of blood TSH, free T(4), and TSH after TRH (T(3) suppression test). Three patients were placed in group 1, with blood TSH levels <10 microU/mL and FT(4)> or =3 ng/dL without clinical or biochemical signs of clinical hypothyroidism. All the patients were asymptomatic. The remaining 13 remained in group 2, with blood TSH levels <10 microU/mL and FT(4) levels <3 ng/dL, and with slight clinical signs of hypothyroidism (difficulties with physical endurance, weakness, cold intolerance, and weight gain). In patients of group 1, total dose of levothyroxine ranged between 75 and 150 microg/day, and in patients of group 2, between 75 and 150 microg/day, with clinical and biochemical normalization of FT(4) levels. These data indicate that mild hypothyroidism in elderly patients may not require treatment with levothyroxine.

Adding a space after '\' using sed is it possible?

Using this sed line is there anyway to add a space after each \, so \ and \ output
as follows using the example above?
a
a\
a\

Thanks

A:

To insert a space after each \, just use a backslash:
$ echo 'a\
a' | sed's/\\/ /'
a
a

This works because s/\\/ / replaces each \ with itself.

Dyspnea perception among patients receiving lung cancer therapy.
Dyspnea perception is an important aspect of quality-of-life. We administered a simple questionnaire to patients with lung cancer and healthy controls to assess their perception of dyspnea after they received therapy but prior to hospital discharge. Subjects were randomized and stratified into groups receiving gemcitabine-carboplatin or etoposide-bleomycin-vincristine-amustamycin-radiotherapy. Dyspnea perception was higher for controls, and there was no significant association between response to therapy and dyspnea perception in either group. Dyspnea perception increased significantly for both groups after the completion of therapy compared to baseline. There were no significant differences in dyspnea perception between the two therapies. Dyspnea perception is enhanced in lung cancer survivors treated with chemotherapy. This information may be used to improve quality-of-care for patients undergoing this treatment.

[Staphylococcus aureus beta-lactamase resistance: recent epidemiological and clinical aspects--part 2: epidemiology, clonal heterogeneity, resistance dissemination and control].
In a part of this review concerning the spread and control of methicillin resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) and methicillin (or oxacillin) resistant coagulase negative staphylococci (MRCoNS), the results, based both on molecular epidemiological and phenotypic techniques, about the spread of this drug resistance in the hospital and community is reported and discussed. MRSA strains isolated from hospital environments belong to hospital or community-associated strains, being highly heterogeneous with regard to the source of epidemiologic origin, to antibiotic resistance, and to the presence of certain virulence factors. Strains of this kind have a greater ability than hospital strains to acquire the capacity to become colonizers and pathogens, mainly when the patient has recently been hospitalized in a nursing-home or long-stay psychiatric hospital. A high proportion of isolates obtained in the community have the capacity to develop into hospital-acquired strains. MRCoNS have not yet been isolated from hospital environments (so-called "community-associated strains"). The increasing use of these organisms, together with the presence of virulence factors, could increase the incidence of MRSA and MRCoNS infections. This development, together with the high frequency of the acquisition of resistance, implies serious problems for their management. The most promising approach to overcoming the problems of these superbugs is based on the implementation of strict antibiotic policy in the hospital, using adequate antibiotic therapy and infection control.

Can I use my own library in a Unity3D project?

For example I create a very simple game for the Android as a hobby.
I don't need anything else then the basic functions of XNA Framework in Unity3D Engine.
As a beginner it takes a long time to understand how everything works together in Unity3D with XNA Framework.
Can I use this game as a framework for other games, using my own library of functions?
Can I even put other games (if yes, which language)
Can I only use the native Unity3D functions, and other functions of mine, but Unity3D should ignore it, or just display the text in the native Unity3D editor?
I would like to know if I can use my own library of functions for this application.
Is this possible, can I do this?

A:

Your question doesn't seem well-considered - I don't believe you're going to build a library, and then expect that library to be usable from the Unity3D projects that you create in the future! In fact, Unity3D is very much focused around building games built with their own proprietary tools and framework.
The concept of a "framework" is pretty broad, and Unity3D is more of a platform than a framework. It has APIs and tools to help designers and devs create games, but it's a framework in the broader programming sense of the word.
If you only want to use things that you understand or have already had some experience of, then it's a pretty poor platform and tool set for you to start on. And that's assuming an IDE is required. Unity's very flexible and allows you to create a game as it suits your purposes, though it means it's a bit of an uphill battle at first.

This is what most people actually do, though - use Unity3d as the framework for their game instead of making a "game framework" of their own that they think they need. This is pretty common practice now and has been the way people have created content in previous years to a lesser extent.
It's definitely an option for doing it - but if you really want to use Unity3d, but it's not the way you want to make games, there are lots and lots of tools available for free to make it do what you actually want. For example, Unity3d comes with a GameObject component that you can create things like "

[Bilateral testicular tumors and the diagnosis of testicular metastases].
The differential diagnosis of testicular masses in young men is difficult, because the testicular masses that are the most common (testicular carcinoma or seminoma, lymphangioma, and varicosities) mimic each other histologically. Because an adenocarcinoma that originates in the seminal vesicles or the prostate gland may give rise to a testicular mass, it is necessary to include testicular metastases in the differential diagnosis. If testicular metastasis is suspected, the patient should undergo a biopsy with histologic confirmation before the operation is performed.

The present invention relates generally to the fields of molecular biology and medicine. More particularly, it concerns methods, compositions and compounds useful in the treatment of a host of inflammatory conditions including urogenital tract inflammation.
2. Description of Related Art
Inflammation is a protective biological response to tissue injury or destructive stimuli, such as pathogens, foreign material, radiation, or inflammatory agents. Inflammation is a complicated physiological response of tissues in response to these destructive stimuli that consists of all the symptoms that result from increased microvascular permeability, tissue infiltration and migration of phagocytes and plasma extravasation of fluid into tissues. These processes that accompany inflammation are designed to eliminate or at least destroy invading organisms or damaged tissue.
In cases where the destruction is inappropriate, or where tissue repair is not complete, a chronic inflammatory process results that can cause significant morbidity and even mortality. One of the most potent immune stimulants are the polysaccharides, including some of the immunomodulators of macrophage activation. It is known that the polysaccharide moiety of LPS serves as a critical binding element for the endotoxin. A further insight into the role of the polysaccharide component in macrophage activation, as well as its role in stimulating the production of monocyte-derived cytokines, which are important mediators of inflammation, has been obtained with the identification of two distinct classes of polysaccharides, namely: bacterial-like, and fungal-like. Bacterial-like polysaccharides can induce in vitro macrophage activation. They are comprised of repeating sequences of β-(1→6)-d-Glcp residues linked via either a β-(1→2)-d-Manp-(1→6)-d-Glc or β-(1→2)-d-Glc-(1→2)-d-Manp-(1→6)-d-Glc repeating units containing the backbone of lipopolysaccharide (LPS) or other liposaccharides in which the polysaccharides are covalently linked to lipid portions containing various lipid chains. These lipid polysaccharides are termed endotoxic lipopolysaccharides (LPSs). For example, in the case of the prototype endotoxin, E. coli LPS, the lipid A moiety is glucosamine-lactose.

Kosovo PM Ramush Haradinaj and his two brothers arrested Published duration 20 January 2013

image caption Mr Haradinaj's arrest on Thursday was the culmination of a months-long investigation, Interior Minister Ramush Haradinaj said

Kosovo PM Ramush Haradinaj and two brothers accused of war crimes by the Hague court have been arrested, the BBC has learned.

Mr Haradinaj's party's deputy, Agim Çeku, told the BBC the men were wanted by the international court in Kosovo's capital, Pristina, for crimes against humanity.

Mr Haradinaj told Kosovo Serbs last week he would not resign.

But he has now said he has resigned as head of the army to take responsibility for the arrest.

The announcement was not made through his party's media unit and he did not specify when and how he had submitted his resignation.

"I resigned as deputy president of the party, but I remain in my post as prime minister until such time as this situation is over," he said in a statement on Friday.

The arrest of Mr Haradinaj, the first politician from the country's ethnic Albanian majority to be targeted in the post-war legal process, was the conclusion to a months-long investigation.

The European Union has urged countries with Kosovan citizenship to hand over Mr Haradinaj for questioning. His extradition is required under a UN security council resolution that established Kosovo in June 1999.

Mr Haradinaj, 41, had been Kosovo's defence and interior minister since October.

As prime minister he would command security forces deployed in Kosovo, including those known in Nato parlance as the Kosovo Protection Corps, whose members, mostly ethnic Albanians, have been involved in some of the heaviest fighting between Kosovo Serb and Kosovo Albanian fighters, Reuters news agency says.

The Pristina authorities also accused him of being one of the organisers of and receiving part of the $3.5m budget of the infamous KLA guerrillas.

Mr Haradinaj was already the highest-profile figure to have been arrested in connection with the Hague court's war crimes tribunal. His brother Sadik and two men who had links to them, were arrested in the port city of The Hague in December 2010 after being indicted for alleged war crimes.

The court had found they played a key role in abuses in the lead-up to and during a 1998-99 war between

# This file is distributed under New Relic's license terms.
# See https://github.com/newrelic/newrelic-ruby/blob/main/LICENSE for complete details.

require 'new_relic/agent_error_inspect'

module NewRelic # :nodoc:
  class ErrorInspector # :nodoc:
    include NewRelic::AgentErrorInspector

    NEW_RELIC_ERROR_INSPECTOR_PATTERN = Regexp.new '.*/newrelic/newrelic-'

    def inspect_errors(errors)
      errors.each do |error|
        message = error[:message].to_s

        return nil if message.nil? || message.empty?

        agent_message = error[:agent_message].to_s

        return nil if agent_message.nil? || agent_message.empty?

        # Some agent's log lines contain errors with no messages associated with
        # them, so we need to strip the agent message if it appears.
        return nil if agent_message.include? "\n" || agent_message.include? "(\n)"

        return message if NEW_RELIC_ERROR_INSPECTOR_PATTERN.match(message)
        # This line is an outlier. The original line should not return the pattern
        # for any error instance if the pattern does not appear in the rest of the
        # error message.
        return message
      end
    end
  end
end

answer: This is a revised application in response to PA-01-069: Special Call for Applications to Shorten the Lifespan of Alzheimer's Disease. Our main aim is to design and develop a comprehensive intervention, based on a brain-computer interface (BCI), to help a patient live with multiple diagnoses in the shortest possible time at home. This may include an initial phase of training in self-regulation to avoid crisis and maintain health and daily living. The intervention incorporates an active research component that will provide the scientific foundation for the design and efficacy testing of the new system in humans. This intervention approach is unique in its comprehensive nature as it provides individualized approaches with the possibility of being scaled up. The specific aims of this application are addressed to the first aim, of designing and developing a comprehensive intervention that could help prevent the progression of AD and the cognitive disabilities of AD. Our hypothesis is that patients with AD would learn brain control and regulation to avoid a cascade of disability. During the first years, we hope to provide an intervention that could be used on a daily basis and eventually may be incorporated into the environment throughout the home in order to prevent further cognitive and functional decline. The intervention is designed to utilize a brain-computer interface to access motor and cognitive aspects of everyday life of mild cognitive impairment (MCI) and AD. Using non-invasive technology such as near-infrared spectroscopy (NIRS) and electroencephalography (EEG), we will monitor cortical activity and motor activity/cognition of the patient in AD and MCI. We will also use a wearable NIRS device and accelerometer to monitor physical activity patterns and movements. In the next years, we will collect the user experience of the intervention approach and determine its effectiveness in older adults with MCI or mild AD who have been tested with an instrument that measures their cognitive status. To help guide the intervention design and provide a scientific and clinical framework for the intervention development process, the investigators will meet with the Advisory Committee composed by the external clinical and scientific experts. We will focus in using BCI technologies to understand and treat motor and cognitive dysfunctions of MCI and AD. A comprehensive intervention can help the patients live with AD in the home. The proposed approach is based on NIRS and EEG and may provide more effective rehabilitation for elderly patients and more effective treatment to older patients who are not cognitively normal but with a high risk of cognitive impairment.

How do I get the current DateTime for a given Day and Time for a Month?

Let's say I have the following:
datetimePickerData.DayOfMonth - 1

The problem is, I would want datetimePickerData.Today() to be the current Date.

A:

You should use the DateTime.Today property instead.

DateTime.Today
Returns the date and time of the current date.

You also might want to check out this code and the docs.
If you need to compare with a specific date, you might use Date.Today and convert the date you want to compare with accordingly.

T-Mobile: Get “Best Buy Wireless”

T-Mobile, one of the only two major US carriers offering unlimited domestic calling and texts, is now offering a way to get “Best Buy Wireless” on your line. It appears that you only have to have a postpaid T-Mobile account and get this as a part of your bill. A post paid T-Mobile customer is a customer who has a contract and pays monthly.

There is a catch; however, it’s not too big one. If you use the wireless phone of the carrier for only 1 yr that the plan expires you will not be able to get the “Best Buy” service. Even better, it seems that the plan expires according to T-mobile itself for no additional charge. (We also found out that it doesn’t matter if you actually renew the line yourself or your carrier does it for you).

This means that you should consider this if you are a customer who is considering switching to T-mobile as it is not a completely free service. Your line can be automatically renewed no matter who you got the phone from.

In case the customer is not getting the Best Buy service automatically, they can request it via phone or visit a location to get it. If they are not satisfied with the plan it is not likely that they are going to pay an extra $20 a month for the service. If they want to get the Best Buy service for an additional $20 a month then I am pretty sure that majority of people are going to consider switching to T-mobile.

Earl Sweatshirt’s second album has been in the making for a minute, and it’s finally here. The Compton rapper’s new record, I Don’t Like Shit, I Don’t Go Outside, isn’t as tightly constructed as last year’s debut, Doris, but it’s just as complex. It’s a big jump forward for the young artist, and a sign that we might actually be seeing a more mature Sweatshirt on our radars in the coming months.

From the opening sounds of “HAPPY,” it’s easy to see this album is different from last year’s. Earl employs different drum patterns, rambling throughout the verses and leaving one chorus or the next open for his rhymes to flow. The beats stick to the core, always driving the song forward with an infectious hook from his uncle, producer Mike G. It feels more polished, with ear-catching beats such as “Older than Ice Cream,” a beat Earl makes no attempt to match on the album. It’s a reminder of Earl’s talents at a creative peak.

“Oldie” is in the same vein as “HAPPY” in that it offers some of the best storytelling in the album, showing us a man that’s grown from a carefree boy into a man that's lost more than he can remember. In “Mt. View,” while at the peak of his voice, he details his struggles with substance abuse and the pressure of the world around him: “I grew up thinking they'd make me a man, and they made me a man/Then I became an outlaw, and then I became a man/So it's like what I know now is what I knew back then/I know this now, I'm not a child no more/I'm the kid that was like 30 some years ago.”

The rapper is more candid on “Halloween,” a song about the day he came up to Compton and first learned the horrors of life in the city. “I ain't seen nothing like that before/I'm gon' leave this place like it's a ghost town/All that it does is remind me of a funeral home,” he raps. Earl uses "Halloween" to show us his growth on his first

A new way of thinking about your health and well being.

The Most Important Question You Will Ever Answer

I love asking questions and I love learning from the answers. The questions I like to ask are ones about my experiences and those of others in my life, in other words: “What has happened in my life? What happened to me to make me think or act this way?“ I love those types of questions.

Why? Because it will ultimately make me question my own behavior when I’m doing it over and again – and it also helps me to understand what I don’t know. When I learn something new, I’m curious to know more and it leads to new thought and changes in behavior.

A few months ago I was fortunate enough to spend time getting to know one of the nurses at my local nursing home. She is older and has done her caregiving for many years now. It was her decision to share with me what she was learning and what her mind was telling her. That was a gift from which I was able to learn many things, too, and also to change my behavior.

At first, I was not entirely comfortable with her sharing with me since I do not consider myself to be a doctor. I am a patient, or visitor, or “other.” I didn’t know if I was qualified to hear what she offered me. The effects of perioperative ketoprofen on postcesarean analgesic requirements and maternal and neonatal safety: a double-blind, placebo-controlled study.
The purpose of this study was to evaluate the effects of perioperative ketoprofen in combination with epidural bupivacaine/fentanyl on morphine-based postcesarean analgesia and maternal and neonatal safety. Maternal and neonatal safety were secondary objectives. A randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study was used. Patients (n = 130) were randomly assigned to receive either ketoprofen (Prontofen) 100 mg administered intravenously (i.v.) or saline 1 mL i.v. immediately before the abdominal incision (group A), epidural anesthesia plus bupivacaine with fentanyl 20 mcg/(mL/mL) plus saline 1 mL i.v. versus epidural anesthesia plus bupivacaine and fentanyl 20 mcg/mL plus Prontofen 100 mg (group B). Morphine in the epidural mixture was given at the time of initial request for analgesia. Data were collected on demographic variables, time to skin closure, and postoperative analgesic requirements. In group A, the time to complete skin closure was significantly reduced (20 vs. 35 min, P = 0.0003) and the mean morphine requirements were significantly reduced (0.36 vs. 0.64 mg, P = 0.04). No significant differences were noted in the incidence of nausea and emesis, and no significant difference were noted in the Apgar scores or the incidence of hyperbilirubinemia. In group B, the time to complete skin closure was no different, but a significant decrease in the postoperative morphine requirement (0.45 vs. 0.65 mg, P = 0.03) was noted. No significant differences were noted in the incidence of nausea and emesis, hyperbilirubinemia, adverse neonatal effects or adverse maternal effects. Administration of perioperative Prontofen 100 mg significantly decreases morphine-based requirements postcesarean section. The data suggest there is no adverse effect on maternal or neonatal outcomes.

Find the number of permutations of the given elements into a set

How many permutations $8$ objects from the set $A=\{1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8\}$ into $B=\{1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6\}$ result in the following sets:

$\{1,4,8\}$, $\{1,4,5\}$, $\{1,4,6\}$, $\{1,4,7\}$?

I have the following solution so far:
The number of possible combinations within $B=\{1,2,3,4,5,6\}$ is 5 and the number of possible combinations within $8$ items total is $8\cdot7\cdot6\cdot5\cdot4=480$
Since both the set and the order matter, the number of combinations is $5!=120$, but the solution given in the book by Ross Millikan shows there are $5+15+6+8+1=31$ sets. Is it a typo?

A:

Number of ways in which at least one of $1,4,5,6,7,8$ can appear is $4$, so number of choices for that part of the subset is $6$. The rest of the combinations of $1,4,5,6$ is not so simple. 
Note that you need to take that first element, then second element, then third element...etc. and then put them into $6$ spaces. If $n$ is the number of elements in the subset then we have $n\cdot(n-1)$ combinations.
In your case $\{1,4,8\}$, $\{1,4,5\}$, $\{1,4,6\}$, $\{1,4,7\}$ these are $4$ spaces and if $x_1$ can appear in one of them, $x_2$ can appear in one of the remaining five. Same for the other two sets.
The total combinations thus becomes:
$$ 4{5\choose 1}^5 \cdot 5!=2405$$

Rails: How to generate RESTful resource endpoints based on a custom convention

In Rails, I use RESTful routing to create resource endpoints like so:
resources :books

The above convention looks for URL's of the form /books, /books/create, and /books/{book_id} - no problem.
What I want to be able to do, however, is create endpoints something like:
/books/conventions
/books/conventions/{convention_id}
/books/conventions/{book_id}
/books/conventions/{convention_id}/edit
/books/conventions/{convention_id}/delete
/books/conventions/{convention_id}/copy
/books/create?convention={conventionId}

How can I take advantage of routing for this? I would like to create the convention endpoint first, and then assign resources to it using the convention id rather than the resource name. So instead of books, my convention might be named conventions and have an id assigned to it. I would then use 
resources :conventions 

to make the convention endpoints. Is there a way to do that in Rails 3?

A:

Add this to your routes.yml file
resources :{conventions}, only: [:show] do
  post :create
end

This will cause any URL ending in conventions to create an action on the conventions API. It's based on convention_id so don't end up with /books/{book_id}/convention, or /conventions/{convention_id}/...
As for convention_id I'm not sure about best practice, but it is used to identify things and generally I think it is best to use a unique identifier.
EDIT: As for your question in the comment.
Yes, you can create resources by hand. You can make your convention resources do what they do right now by not adding :actions at the end of the namespace declaration or anything, but just:
resources :{conventions}, :only => :show do
  post :create
end

If you don't want to expose the entire resource, you can specify :only to indicate that only some methods should be exposed.
There is also:

Loss-of-function mutations in the EYS gene are associated with isolated childhood autosomal recessive cone dystrophy.
The EYS gene encodes 2 proteins, which are expressed in the retina and other tissues. Most of the human cases of ciliopathies, which are a group of genetic retinal dystrophies, are caused by mutations in the EYS gene. To identify all of the EYS gene variations in Chinese patients with isolated nonsyndromic cone dystrophy (COD) and to explore the relationship between the clinical features of COD and the mutations. Mutation screening of the EYS gene was performed by using denaturing high-performance liquid chromatography in 20 patients with isolated COD. Bioinformatics analysis was used to detect the effect of the identified mutations on protein structure. A loss-of-function mutation in exon 6 of EYS (c.1339+2T>C) segregated with COD in all of the 20 patients, and the mutation was also observed in the unaffected parents. The EYS mutation identified in this study was the most prevalent loss-of-function mutation in Chinese patients with isolated COD. Based on bioinformatics analysis, the c.1339+2T>C mutation may result in splice site mutation of the EYS gene. Our findings may help resolve the molecular pathogenesis of COD.

What is the European Central Bank and why does it have such a big impact on the global economy today?

According to the central banking agency in Europe, the ECB is the most powerful bank in the world—that is, it has a dominant role in setting the monetary policy in the euro zone and other countries that rely on the euro.

The ECB’s chief responsibility is to keep eurozone governments of all ideological stripes (and the United States too) solvent as the region suffers its worst economic downturn since World War II. If this was not difficult enough, the fact that several member states are struggling in different ways complicates the ECB’s task.

The ECB has created new measures to help European banks to avoid bankruptcy following the euro zone debt crisis of 2011 and 2013. But it is unclear how much longer these can work as central banks elsewhere in the developed world have also put in place policies to help their banks, although to a much lesser extent than the ECB.

ECB President Mario Draghi.

The ECB’s main tool to preserve the continent’s monetary union is its newly revised Target 2.0 banking reserve target, which says that eurozone central banks must maintain a ratio of 10% of the total credit they provide to the banking system as a whole. However, if banks are short of money for some reason, they can increase their Target 2.0 ratios by borrowing from the central bank.

The new rules are not very radical because they require central banks to maintain a reserve ratio of at least 10% of the total credit they provide to the system as a whole. However, in an emergency, the European Central Bank can intervene by lending more money to banks against that percentage so that they can lend out more credit.

What are the economic incentives the ECB can offer for keeping banks solvent?

As part of its response to the Eurocrisis, the ECB also created TARGET2.1, which has two major characteristics. First, according to TARGET2.1, central banks are supposed to lend additional funds, without limit, to banks in financial distress. Therefore, even banks that are highly risk-averse can benefit from the new tool.

K-pop superstars SM Entertainment recently unveiled their newest batch of recruits. The members on the latest SM-eul program are already making a name for themselves not only for their incredible talent but for a scandal that came to light before the actual start of the SM-eul process.

SM Entertainment has been under fire after it was revealed that several of their most talented stars who appeared on the SM-eul process were found to have had an inappropriate relationship with their agency mentors.

There was even talk of a possible scam in which the trainee recruits were actually a different group of people altogether than they claimed to be.

However, things seem to have changed for the better since the company has announced that their upcoming SM-eul program will run on the SM Entertainment official blog.

For those of you who care, the new program is called SM-eul Program #2. It will only take place on the SM Entertainment official website instead of the usual Korean entertainment news portal site.

For those of you who are wondering, SM Entertainment CEO Lee Gi-hyeon explains (via Soompi) that the change is in order to make it less intrusive on the recruits' personal life.

[They also explained in the interview that the recruits will no longer be "forced to sing and dance" with their agency mentors. Instead, they will be allowed to use all the training programs as they see fit.]

The SM Entertainment officials also revealed some information about their new trainee recruits.

Yuk Joo Hyun will return to the SM-eul program after his leave from SM Entertainment

Tohoshinki will be re-joined by two new male trainees (one of them is a trainee from a previous SM-eul program)

And lastly, Yoon Hyun-sang will return to the SM-eul program

There is no official word on how much of an investment SM Entertainment put into this training process, but the agency has stressed that it's all about their fans.

According to the CEO, SM Entertainment was ready to give up on the next generation of trainees right after the results of their predecessor SM-eul program was announced.

This is because the agency was afraid that it would lose the public's interest in the young celebrities.

This SM Entertainment official blog post also gives fans the chance to see SM Entertainment's new trainee members in action during their next comeback period
